shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

This paragraph does not apply to EQUIPMENT and UTENSIL cleaners and SANITIZERS that are stored in WAREWASHING areas for availability and convenience if the materials are stored to prevent contamination of FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES; item moved.

shortdesc: Food obtained from approved source
comments: 3-201.11; Priority Foundation;  Unopened packaged kimchi (purchased in this form from a market in Durham County) observed that lacks ingredient labeling.  Packaged food shall be labeled as specified in law, including ingredient labeling.  PLEASE NOTE:  Kimchi is the product of a fermentation process that, under NC Food Code, typically requires a variance.  Do not purchase a kimchi product for use in the establishment unless it is known to be prepared and packaged under an approved process regulated by either DHHS through the NC Food Code or the Department of Agriculture.  With the existing labeling, there is no indication that this product is either. Please do not use this product and remove it from the establishment.

shortdesc: Food obtained from approved source

shortdesc: Food obtained from approved source
comments: 3-201.14; Priority; There was only one invoice on hand for the salmon. There was no other invoice on hand for the fish that is used for sushi. The manager stated his wife took the invoices home. Keep all documents on hand to show that the fish has come from an approved source. Will make a return visit.

shortdesc: Food obtained from approved source
comments: 3-202.14; Priority; Raw eggs purchased at the farmers market did not have any labeling or indication as to where they came from. Please do not use these eggs. All foods must come from approved sources and eggs must be pasteurized. Egg products shall be obtained pasteurized. P CDI- Eggs were removed.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: P - 3-202.11 - Chic-fil-A chicken nuggets were delivered at establishment at 132F. Upon arrival, they shall be at 135F or above. NOTE: Always check temperatures of delivered cold or hot potentially hazardous foods using calibrated thermometer. Cold foods shall be 45F or less and hot foods shall be 135F or above.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: 3-202.11 - Food was being delivered at the time of the inspection. Found containers of yogurt to be 47-51 degrees F. Food should be at a temperature of 41 degrees F or below when received. CDI - educated manager on taking temperatures of received foods and to not accept foods out of temperature. Due to food being colder in the center and warmer on the sides it appeared that food was not out of temperature long, therefore the food was placed in the walk-in cooler.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: 3-202.11; Priority; Tofu brought in from market was at 46F. All foods must arrive at the facility at 41F or below.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: 3-202.11; Priority; Unopened Bulk Deli Meat TURKEY was probably transported recently (although no one is claiming knowledge). Food shall be transported and received at 41'F and colder.  Turkey found at 58'F in a box, in the walk-in cooler.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: 3-202.11; Priority; Meal trays were delivered during inspection but were not hot enough. A sheet was sent with the food showing that the food was 180F and that preparation was finished at 7:15AM. The food was delivered at 10:15AM. The trays are delivered in an insulated bag but it does not appear that they bags are kept hot during transport. Food is supposed to be delivered at 135F or greater. This facility has an oven and was able to reheat the food before service but the delivery company needs to work on properly maintaining proper temperatures during transport.

shortdesc: Food received at proper temperature
comments: 3-202.11; Priority; Eggs and milk at 47F in refrigerator. PIC in the process of putting away foods stated that the delivery had arrived ten minutes prior to EHS arrival. Food temperatures must be taken upon delivery, they must be at or below 41F or delivery is to be refused.  The only thermometers available in the facility were still in their original boxes. EHS provided Risk Control Plan and sample delivery log to be completed for each delivery over the course of the next ten days and copy emailed or faxed to EHS at karla.crowder@wakegov.com or fax# 919-743-4772 on Friday June 19th.

comments: 7-201.11; Priority; Chemicals stored over clean linens; POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS shall be stored so they can not contaminate FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES by:

Separating the POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS by spacing or partitioning; and locating the POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS in an area that is not above FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE or SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. This paragraph does not apply to EQUIPMENT and UTENSIL cleaners and SANITIZERS that are stored in WAREWASHING areas for availability and convenience if the materials are stored to prevent contamination of FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. Product moved.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; While there were clean dishes on the drainboard and sanitizer solution in the 3 compartment sink, pieces from the rotiserrie oven were sprayed down with chemical in the rinse (center) basin of the 3 compartment sink. Hazardous or toxic chemicals should be used in a manner that will not contaminate clean items. Clean items should be removed before chemicals are sprayed that could splash and contaminate them.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Observed employee using 409 cleaner to clean the counter in the beverage area, there is potential for spray/splatter onto nozzles and other food contact surfaces while using the cleaner. Do not use hazardous chemicals around food contact surfaces. For cleaning during hours of operation or when beverage dispensing equipment is set up, food contact sanitizer should be used for wiping counters. If use of chemicals is needed during operation, spray cleaner onto a rag away from beverage dispening equipment or any other food contact surfaces. Discussed issue with employees during inspection, CDI.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority;  Label on sanitizer in use for food surfaces does not include instructions for food contact surface use.  This product has been provided by chemical vendor knowing that this is a restaurant and knowing its intended use, according to PIC.  Contact chemical vendor immediately and verify that this product is appropriate for food contact surfaces.  In the meantime, recommend that establishment use 50-200 ppm chlorine (in new buckets and spray bottles not previously used for currently used sanitizer).  Toxic materials shall be used according to Law, and Law requires that they be used only as indicated by label.  Follow up on 12/19 to verify that establishment is working with chemical vendor on a solution to this issue.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Cascade Extra Action made for domestic dish washers is being used in a commercial dish mahcine. It is not measured, is being left open, and has been spilled all over the outside of the dish machine. It is not being used per manufacturer's instructions. CDI by instructing owner's wife that the Cascade may no be used. The Cascade gel must be removed.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Stainless steel cleaner applied to refrigeration put on in excess. Units still glistening and very wet including door handles after over 2 hours of dry time.  Follow labeling directions. Directions very specific about removing excess.   Excess removed before REHS departed.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; During inspection, employee was instructed to clean and sanitize a cutting board. First, employee poured bleach directly onto a wet cloth and proceeded to wipe down the board. EHS informed employee that is was not a safe use of chemicals on a food contact surface. It was suggested to mix a bucket of bleach and water solution. Solution was mixed but was registering too high according to EHS's test strip. Sanitizer solution is safe to use around food and on  food contact surfaces so it should not be stronger than 50-200 ppm of chlorine in water. EHS instructed employee on proper mixing of sanitizer solution and advised that test strips should be used every time solution was made. The cutting board was thoroughly rinsed and then sanitized again. The bucket of sanitizer solution was re-mixed and corrected. CDI

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

The dispenser needs to be repaired or replaced and should not be used while it is actively leaking or the clean to dirty flow could be changed so that any potential chemical contamination will be removed before sanitizing. Clean to dirty flow was changed during inspection, CDI.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in all spray bottles measured at well over 400 ppm. Sanitizer concentration must be maintained between 200-400 ppm for food-contact purposes. Upon further inspection the directions for use were for a sanitizer solution of 660 ppm. For food-contact purposes, mix sanitizer with less concentrate than currently using and use available test strips to make a solution that is the correct concentration (200-400 ppm). CDI-Educated operator and to use lower (correct) concentration and pointed out that manufacturer's instructions explicitly say 660 ppm, for disinfection (not sanitization) levels.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quaternary ammonia sanitizer in 3-compartment sink measured at over 500 ppm. At a concentration over 400 ppm, quaternary ammonia sanitizer is toxic, and not rated for food-contact surfaces. When filling sanitizer from dispenser, fill sink halfway with sanitizer and the rest of the way with cold water. CDI-Drained half of sink, filled with cold water, and sanitizer re-tested at 300 ppm (which is an appropriate concentration).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Disinfectant was being used to sanitize the table area in the dinning room. This is sometimes a food contact surfaces and shall not be cleaned with disinfectant. Only use sanitizer that meets PH requirements to clean food contact surfaces. CDI0-education

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quat sanitizer in 3 comp sink was over 500 ppm. When sanitizer was remade it still tested too strong. Recommended that the facility contact their chemical provider immediately. Also advised that they dilute the sanitizer with water to lower the concentration strength. All quat sanitizer shall be between 200-400 ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; During inspection, the sanitizer solution being used in the 3 compartment sink was observed to have bubbles. It was found that splashless bleach had been used to make the solution. The other bleach available in the facility was scented. Splashless and scented bleach products are not approved for sanitizing and could lead to chemical contamination due to residue left by the scent or surfactant agents. The solution in the sink was discarded and the sink was thoroughly rinsed. Plain bleach should be purchased or the sanitizing concentrate for the dish machine may be used to make sanitizing solution at the 3 compartment sink.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quaternary ammonium sanitizer is over 400ppm of quaternary ammonium at the 3 compartment sink.  Use 200-400ppm of quaternary ammonium. Sanitizer shall not exceed the manufacturer's instructions.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority;  REQUIRES THE CHLORINE SANITIZER SPRAY BOTTLES TO MEASURE FROM 50 PPM MIN.  TODAY THE TEST STRIP BORDERED ON BLEACHING OUT.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority - Chlorine bleach-water sanitizer in spray bottle was greater than 200 ppm (test strip bleached out). Chlorine based sanitizer shall be 50-200 ppm. CDI by correcting sanitizer concentration. (NOTE: Also ensure bottles are properly labeled bleach + water (not just bleach) if they contain bleach water--7-102.11).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; bottle of bleach was too strong and bleached out the paper. This was remade to 50-200 ppm for bleach. Sanitizers shall be made to the correct concentration for the chemical used.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in bucket tested 500ppm. Keep Quat sanitizer between 200-300ppm. Sanitizer diluted.  Chemical SANITIZERS and other chemical antimicrobials applied to FOOD-CONTACT SURFACEs shall meet the requirements specified in 40 CFR 180.940 Tolerance exemptions for active and inert ingredients for use in antimicrobial formulations (food-contact surface sanitizing solutions).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 . The sanitizer in the spray bottle turned the test strip blue instantly. Mix sanitizer according to the directions and test with the test strips. Keep quat sanitizer at 150-300 ppm. Chemical SANITIZERS and other chemical antimicrobials applied to FOOD-CONTACT SURFACEs shall meet the requirements specified in 40 CFR 180.940 Tolerance exemptions for active and inert ingredients for use in antimicrobial formulations (food-contact surface sanitizing solutions).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; The sanitizer in all of the sanitizer spray bottles was about 5 times too strong. The color was bright pink and when it is properly mixed it is mostly clear. When you follow the instructions for filling the sink and then dip the spray bottles out of the sink the solution is about 400 parts per million. The Quaternary Ammonia Compound (QAC) sanitizer must be in the range of 200 to 400 ppm. (We dumped out all of the sanitizer spray bottles and refilled them from the sanitizer sink.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

Make sure to properly train employees on how to mix sanitizer solutions and make sure that they are checking the concentration of the solution using a test strip. The bleach was poured out and water was added to the bottle resulting in a properly mixed sanitizer solution.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 A) Except for a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that obtains a VARIANCE as specified under § 3502.11, a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that PACKAGES POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD) using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method shall control the growth and toxin formation of Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes. P

(B) A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that PACKAGES POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS FOOD (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL FOR SAFETY FOOD) using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method shall have a HACCP PLAN that contains the information specified under ¶ 8 201.14(D) and that: Pf
(1) Identifies the FOOD to be PACKAGED; Pf
(2) Except as specified under ¶¶ (C) - (E) of this section, requires that the PACKAGED FOOD shall be maintained at 5°C (41°F) or less and meet at least one of the following criteria: Pf
(a) Has an AW of 0.91 or less, Pf
(b) Has a PH of 4.6 or less, Pf
(c) Is a MEAT or POULTRY product cured at a FOOD PROCESSING PLANT regulated by the USDA using substances specified in 9 CFR 424.21, Use of food
ingredients and sources of radiation, and is received in an intact PACKAGE, Pf or
(d) Is a FOOD with a high level of competing organisms such as raw MEAT, raw POULTRY, or raw vegetables; Pf

shortdesc: Thermometers provided & accurate
comments: 4-204-112; Thermometer, Temperature Measuring Devise not functioning on meat refrigerator.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12  There is a vacuum pack machine and Sean says sometimes we do sous vide. (It is not being used tonight.) ... (D)a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that PACKAGES FOOD using a cook-chill or sous vide process shall:
(1) Implement a HACCP PLAN that contains the information as specified under  8-201.14(D);
(2) Ensure the FOOD is:

(a) Prepared and consumed on the PREMISES, or prepared and consumed off the PREMISES but within the same business entity with no distribution or sale of the PACKAGED product to another business entity or the CONSUMER,
(b) Cooked to heat all parts of the FOOD to a temperature and for a time as specified under  3-401.11,
(c) Protected from contamination before and after cooking as specified under Parts 3-3 and 3-4,
(d) Placed in a PACKAGE with an oxygen barrier and sealed before cooking, or placed in a PACKAGE and sealed immediately after cooking and before reaching a temperature below 57C (135F),
(e) Cooled to 5C (41F) in the sealed PACKAGE or bag as specified under  3-501.14 and subsequently:
(i) Cooled to 1C (34F) within 48 hours of reaching 5C (41F) and held at that temperature until consumed or discarded within 30 days after the date of PACKAGING;

(ii) Cooled to 1C (34F) within 48 hours of reaching 5C (41F), removed from refrigeration equipment that maintains a 1C (34F) food temperature and then held at 5C (41F) or less for no more than 72 hours, at which time the FOOD must be consumed or discarded;
(iii) Cooled to 3C (38F) or less within 24 hours of reaching 5C (41F) and held there for no more than 72 hours from PACKAGING, at which time the food must be consumed or discarded;  or
(iv) Held frozen with no shelf life restriction while
frozen until consumed or used.
(f) Held in a refrigeration unit that is equipped with an electronic system that continuously monitors time and temperature and is visually examined for proper operation twice daily,

(g) If transported off-site to a satellite location of the same business entity, equipped with verifiable electronic monitoring devices to ensure that times and temperatures are monitored during transportation,  and
(h) Labeled with the product name and the date PACKAGED; and
(3) Maintain the records required to confirm that cooling and cold holding refrigeration time/temperature parameters are required as part of the HACCP PLAN and:
(a) Make such records available to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY upon request,  and
(b) Hold such records for at least 6 months;

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Tilapia is thawed in Reduced Oxygen Packaging and held inside refrigerator. Manufacture labeling is limited to instruction to store frozen.  Typically, FISH is required to remain FROZEN the entire time it is in the vacuum packaging.  Fish should be removed from packaging BEFORE thawing.  Contact manufacture for guidance.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Vacuum Packaged Salmon is thawed & refrigerated. Labeling on each and every package: "remove all packaging. thaw under refrigeration." This was addressed on the last inspection. It may be dangerous to have fish not frozen in reduced oxygen packaging. Fish should be removed from packaging before thawing to prevent botulism and scrombo toxin formation.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Vacuum Sealed Bags of Tuna Steaks are stored in the refrigerated drawer and walk-in cooler thawed. Each individual bag is stamped with instructions from the manufacture to remove tuna from packaging before thawing.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12;Priority Foundation; Facility doing ROP of raw beef and does not have a HACCP Plan or a Variance; EHS is to get Head Chef information about developing a plan; A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: (A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; (B) Curing FOOD; (C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: (1) As a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement, or (2) To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL OF SAFETY FOOD); (D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12; (E) Operating a MOLLUSCAN SHELLFISH life-support system display tank used to store or display shellfish that are offered for human consumption; (F) Custom processing animals that are for personal use as FOOD and not for sale or service in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT; (G) Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; or (H) Sprouting seeds or beans. Educated on rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; HACCP plan is not being properly followed. Cooling logs are not being completed according to HACCP plan or dated. Foods going through the cook-chill process are not being monitored until they reach 38 F as required. In addition to that, some foods are not reaching 70 F within two hours but are not being discarded as plan requires. HACCP logs are also maintained haphazardly with no clear organizational/chronological date system in place. Date cooling logs, keep them organized, and follow the required cooling parameters outlined in HACCP plan.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; The last entry on the log for sushi rice was on Sunday 9/20/15. Employees had made acidified rice on Monday and today but nothing had been logged for today or yesterday. Be sure to follow the procedures for taking and recording the pH of the acidified rice at the sushi station.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Manager on duty did not have knowledge of HACCP plan location. Cook-chill was actively occurring during inspection. All staff, especially management staff, must have knowledge of where HACCP plan is located so that it can be provided to the regulatory authority upon request and also to reference as needed. CDI-Manager called General Manager, found HACCP plan, and provided it to the Health Inspector.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Cooling logs are being completed appropriately, however, the SOPs in the HACCP plan, the flow charts in the HACCP plan, and the cooling log in the HACCP plan require hourly interval temperature monitoring. This is important because cooling doesn't 'start' until food drops to 135 F. Most soups are getting bagged at 160-190 F. The first hour of cooling is important to record in order to know when soups dropped to 135 F. Use the cooling logs that have hourly slots in the HACCP plan.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Here is a list of unapproved items discovered today: 1) Operator stated that deli meats are sometimes vacuum sealed after being opened. 2)Cooked spiral ham was vacuum packaged on site. 3)Cooked pork belly was vacuum sealed on site. 4)Cheeses were vacuum packaged on site with up to 6 months of time on label. 5)A sous-vide circulator was found, which is not an approved process at this facility. 6)Precooked grape leaves were vacuum sealed on site. 7)Salmon bisque soup was vacuum sealed and frozen. 8)Toro tuna belly was vacuum packaged on site. 9)Frog legs were vacuum packaged on site. 10)Operator stated that smoking of bacon is occurring outside. All of these items/processes are not approved. Discontinue all of these practices. CDI-Most items discarded as needed. If unapproved procedures continue to occur on site, your permit could be suspended. At some point staff have to discontinue vacuum sealing anything that does not have approval OR approval needs to be granted in order for these processes to take place.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; All June HACCP logs were reviewed today. Cooling logs were missing or incomplete for 6/10 and 6/23. Cooling logs are not being completed to show that food is cooling from 135 F to 70 F within 2 hours and from 70 F to 41 F within an additional 4 hours. Cooling logs must be completed until product cools to 41 F and food must cool from 135 F to 70 F within 2 hours and from 70 F to 41 F within an additional 4 hours. Complete logs for the next 10 days accurately and email them to your health inspector at johanna.hill@wakegov.com OR text message them to (919)280-3216. If logs are still not being completed or are not emailed/texted to inspector in that time frame an intent to suspend your permit will be issued. Elizabeth Freeman did record these discrepancies in Olive Garden's 'Red Book' Manager Log.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Food Safety and Quality Manager HACCP Check Logs, Line Readiness Verification Logs, and Fire Charts are not being completed as required by HACCP plan. Some or all of these logs were missing from HACCP files for dates 6/3, 6/7, 6/10, and 6/12. All of these logs must be completed and kept on file for at least 6 months. Complete logs for the next 10 days accurately and email/text them to your health inspector at johanna.hill@wakegov.com or (919)280-3216. If logs are still not being completed or are not emailed to inspector in that time frame an intent to suspend your permit will be issued.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: C - 8-201.13 (and 3-502.12) - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (reduced oxygen packaging of raw meats and salmon) but no approved HACCP plan is in place. This process of vacuum packaging raw meats and fish requires a HACCP plan but NOT a variance. Within 10 days, develop and submit a HACCP plan to our department (Attention: Lucy Schrum), following the requirements of 8-201.14 which includes the contents of a HACCP plan. Discontinue immediately the vacuum packaging of raw unfrozen salmon or any other seafood. Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core;  No HACCP plan available for making yogurt; Before engaging in an activity that requires a HACCP PLAN, a PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall submit to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY for approval a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 8 201.14 and the relevant provisions of this Code if: (1) Submission of a HACCP PLAN is required according to LAW; (2) A VARIANCE is required as specified under Subparagraph 3-401.11(D)(4), ? 3 502.11, or ? 4 204.110(B); (3) The REGULATORY AUTHORITY determines that a FOOD preparation or processing method requires a VARIANCE based on a plan submittal specified under ? 8 201.12, an inspectional finding, or a VARIANCE request. (B) A PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall have a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 3 502.12For a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that is required under ? 8 201.13 to have a HACCP PLAN, the plan and specifications shall indicate; work on HACCP plan to prove yogurt is safe.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; Facility using nitrites in facility for preparation of food and need a HACCP plan and variance; stop using product in facility until HACCP plan and variance are in place; educated on rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; What appeared to be a domestic vacuum sealer (but this could not be verified if it were domestic) was seen in kitchen. When the operator was asked about what it was used for, operator explained that it was used to seal portioned tuna belly to maintain proper color. The fish pieces come in whole and frozen, belly meat is portioned out, cut while frozen and sealed while frozen using a vacuum sealer. An octopus was also observed today sealed using the vacuum sealer in the walk-in freezer. All items that are sealed using sealer are 'fish' and arrive frozen, are cut frozen, and are stored frozen until use. Regardless, to use a vacuum sealer to seal fish a HACCP Plan must be written, followed, and reviewed by the regulatory authority. Write a HACCP plan and submit to johanna.hill@wakegov.com for review. If no HACCP plan has been drafted by next inspection, points will be taken.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; Facility had ROPed foods such as cooked pork and cream cheese in freezer. In order to do a specialized process such as ROP prior approval from our department must be obtained. HACCP plan must be completed and turned into our department. shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

Continue to handle this product using the procedures that were previously approved and apply for the variance.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (making yogurt on site) that falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. Specialized processes require that a variance be obtained and a HAACP plan be put in place. If this process is necessary for operation of establishment, e-mail documentation of the process, including all ingredients and procedures, to your inspector. Additional guidance will be provided by your inspector once a framework has been set up to handle variances and HAACP plans. CDI by educating PIC.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 Variance Requirement. - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice) that falls outside of the normal limits set by the Rules.  A process such as this requires that a variance be obtained and that a HAACP plan be put in place.  Email documentation of the process, including all ingredients and procedures, to your inspector at jamesrsmith@wakegov.com .  Additional guidance will be provided by your inspector once a framework has been set up to handle variances and HAACP plans.  In the meantime, restore use of pH logs as documented above and otherwise continue with existing procedure.  Violation CDI by this guidance.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 Variance Requirement. - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice/making yogurt on site/performing reduced oxygen packaging) that falls outside of the normal limits set by the Rules.  A process such as this requires that a variance be obtained and that a HAACP plan be put in place.  If practicable, recommend that establishment discontinue this process.  If this process is necessary for operation of the establishment, email documentation of the process, including all ingredients and procedures, to your inspector within 10 days.  Additional guidance will be provided by your inspector once a framework has been set up to handle variances and HAACP plans.  Submittal of procedure within 10 days  or discontinuance of process will be considered correction in the meantime.

Dish detergent powder for home dish washers should not be used in short cycle commercial dish machines, as the short cycle may not fully rinse detergent residue from dishes, leading to chemical contamination of food contact utensils and containers. CDI by discussion with employees and manager and having employees thoroughly clean and rinse the machine.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice for sushi) that falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. Specialized processes require that a variance be obtained and a HAACP plan be put in place. If the acidifying of rice is necessary for operation of your establishment, must submit all applicable documentation to the State of North Carolina within 30 days (variance guidance document given to PIC during inspection). For further guidance on this rule, contact your inspector. CDI by informing PIC of requirement.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11- This facility is preparing acidified sushi rice so that it is non-potentially hazardous. This is a specialized process that requires according to NC Food Code. A variance application needs to be submitted and approved in order to use this specialized process. Contact Angela Myers at angela.myers@wakegov.com for more information regarding the variance application process. CDI by educating PIC, will follow up on variance application during next inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 Variance Requirement - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice for sushi) that falls outside of the normal limits set by the Food Code. A process such as this requires that a variance be obtained and that a HAACP plan be put in place. Alternatively, Time in Lieu of Temperature control procedures may be written and kept on site - see inspector for details. CDI by educating manager.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 VARIANCE obtained from the state variance committee is required to acidiy rice and hold without temperature control (unless it is labeled to be discarded in 4 hours or less).

Establishment observed to acidify rice with the intention of rendering it a non-PHF. Variance request information provided today.  An alternative to maintaining the rice above 135'F or refrigerating below 45/41'F is to have written procedures that are followed with rice labeled and held for a maximum of 4 hours; food must be discarded at 4 hours.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice for sushi) that falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. Specialized processes require that a variance be obtained and a HAACP plan be put in place. No approved variance documentation was provided at time of inspection. Variance paperwork was left with person in charge. CDI by informing PIC of requirements.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11  After discussing the need for a varaince or using Time as a Public Health Control for sushi rice held at room temperature, the PIC decided that Time as a Public Health Control was the way to go.  One was written today and will be used from this point forward. He is not holding the rice for more than 4 hours anyway so this works well.  The variance will not be needed.

Reduced oxygen packaging may require that a variance be obtained from the state variance committee. See 3-502.12 for procedures requiring no variance. Submit paperwork to variance committee to request a variance if needed (providing variance packet). Also submit to inspector complete written procedures for cook-chill ROP and include type of bag used. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection. CDI by discussing with PIC.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (fermentation of yogurt on site) that falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. This specialized process requires that a variance be obtained from the State of North Carolina and a HAACP plan be put in place (HAACP to be submitted with variance request). shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility curing corned beef using nitrite compound; must have a variance and a HACCP plan; A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: (A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; (B) Curing FOOD; (C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: (1) As a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement, or (2) To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL OF SAFETY FOOD); (D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12; Pf

(E) Operating a MOLLUSCAN SHELLFISH life-support system display tank used to store or display shellfish that are offered for human consumption; (F) Custom processing animals that are for personal use as FOOD and not for sale or service in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT; (G) Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; or (H) Sprouting seeds or beans. Educated on rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; When partially cooking meat, be sure to have a written procedure on how it is done and make it available to the inspector when asked for; follow what it states in rule 3-401.14 regarding creating your procedure; educated on rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment is doing cook-chill without an approved variance from the state. Manager on duty stated that an application was submitted in February of 2013, but, no application or HACCP plan could be provided at time of inspection. It may be possible to apply for Reduced Oxygen Packaging Without a Variance through Wake County instead of applying for a variance from the state. Email johanna.farmer@wakegov.com the variance application to see if current cook-chill process requires variance from the state or not.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility par cooking chicken wings and tuna; A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; reviewed with manager.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process on site--fermentation of cut cabbage for kimchee--which falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. This specialized process does not have an approve variance. Specialized processes require that a variance be obtained and a HAACP plan be put in place and followed. Immediately stop making kimchee in this restaurant. Kimchee can only come from an approved commercial source. CDI by informing PIC of requirement, referring to variance application given during last inspection (paperwork is still in PIC's possession but has not been completed). An agreement was made to take about half of kimchee home and leave half of it in restaurant to be used for customers.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; D Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12;

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation;  REQUIRES A VARIANCE FOR OPERATING WITH A TWO COMP SINK. TRANSITIONAL ITEM FOR THREE COMP REPLACEMENT

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 (A) . The restaurant seals soups in air tight bags with a vacuum sealer. This process now requires a HACCP plan and a variance. Since the soup is only given a shelf life of 3 days after sealing, it would be much easier to use regular food storage pans with lids instead of sealed bags. Cool and date mark the soups like any other cooked food. The walk-in cooler is cold enough to give you a 7 day shelf life.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Priority; FISH received in Vacuum Packaging needs to be opened or removed from ROP bag before thawing.  Most packages of vacuum sealed fish are labeled with instructions to open or vent or remove packaging entirely. Fish should only be stored in anaerobic bags when it is frozen; this is a control measure for Clostridium botulinum.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Facility uses a Reduced-Oxygen-Packing(ROP) method for raw steaks, fish, and chicken to help maintain freshness. The facility does not have a HAACP plan in place. Unfrozen raw fish is not to be used with ROP methods. CDI - educated the manager. Talked to him about creating an HAACP plan for the steak and chicken. I will gather more information for the manager and get back to him regarding whether or not he can use ROP for the raw fish.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 - Found chicken breasts to be subjected to ROP procedures. There is a HACCP plan in place for ROP in this facility. The chicken breasts were not listed in the ROP Log. Be sure to follow the approved procedures in the HACCP plan. CDI - Chicken breast were being discarded due to reaching its 10 day shelf life.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 No HACCP plan available for the ROP packaging of cooked ribs; develop a HACCP plan and variance needed to ROP food in facility as per stated rule; educated on new rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 - Found ROP raw chicken out in the self-service cooler that was prepared yesterday and it was not logged in the log book. All approved HACCP procedures must be followed when doing ROP. CDI - had the manager log the chicken in the log book.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.12 - Observed that a few cheeses are vacuum packaged in this establishment and no HACCP plan has been put into place for this process. CDI by informing PIC of requirement. Additional information will be provided to comply with this item.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Priority Foundation - Observed that several cheeses are vacuum packaged in this establishment and no HACCP plan has been put into place for this process. Discontinue vacuum packaging cheeses until HACCP plan has been put into place (and a variance is put into place, if required). CDI by informing PIC of requirement. NOTE: Additional information will be provided to comply with this item and to determine if a variance is also required.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Priority Foundation - Observed that several cheeses are vacuum packaged in this establishment and no HACCP plan has been put into place for this process. Discontinue vacuum packaging cheeses until HACCP plan has been put into place (and a variance is put into place, if required). CDI by informing PIC of requirement. NOTE: Additional information will be provided to comply with this item and to determine if a variance is also required.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12;(B)(4) Your HACCP plan says to have a 10 day sell by date on the ROP packages that you prepare. The sell by dates were all 14 days.  This type of package is limited to being refrigerated  to no more than 14 calendar days from PACKAGING to consumption, except the time the product is maintained frozen. The package should also have a use by or freeze by date.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Priority Foundation; HACCP must ensure that ROP foods are consumed on site (or within same business entity), facility is donating ROP foods to a food bank. Walk in cooler temp log shows a requirement of 40F, ROP foods must be at 38F or below for storing.  Date marking instructions are limited to one line in the flow chart stating a max 72 hour hold.  More complete training procedures and records needed, PIC was able to locate cleaning procedures (though most said to put in dish machine w/o operating requirements). SOPs for No bare hand contact on ready to eat foods, handwashing, access to processing equipment limited to responsible, trained personnel familiar with the potential hazards of the operation, cross contamination are all required. EHS recommends keeping a binder with all the requirements available for a quicker review.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 (D)(2)(f) . The walk-in cooler is equipped with a continuous temperature monitoring device, but the data is only downloaded once a month. It does not help you in any way if you know that the cooler was too warm three weeks ago. Temperature is checked on other thermometers only once in the morning ( according to the log sheet).(f) Held in a refrigeration unit that is equipped with an electronic system that continuously monitors time and temperature and is visually examined for proper operation twice daily,

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Priority Foundation; Facility is approved to do ROP for raw foods but observed ROP of cooked foods. The HACCP plan in place does not allow for ROP of cooked foods(only raw foods). Facility also did not have any cold hold temperature logs, transportation/receiving logs or an corrective action written out. The HACCP plan approved requires that logs and documentation of all these actions are kept. ROP food packages were lacking important labeling such as: "discard in 14 days, maintain food product at 41 degrees and below". The cooked meats that were vacuum packaged were with in 48 hours of processing and items were bagged in other food grade bags to be used within 7 days. Will do a VR visit to ensure that no more cooked foods are going through ROP, package labeling is adequate in regards to the HACCP plan and Log sheet is adequately filled out and kept on file.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Priority; Facility may not 'can' hot sauce without a submitted and approved HACCP plan. Reduced oxygen packaging may be done without a variance if the final product has a pH of 4.6 or less. PIC states facility will discontinue the hot water bath and will sell the product in packaging that is clearly not ROP.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Priority Foundation; Facility has a HACCP plan for ROP foods but it is not in the facility; If the REGULATORY AUTHORITY grants a VARIANCE as specified in § 8 103.10, or a HACCP PLAN is otherwise required as specified under § 8 201.13, the PERMIT HOLDER shall: (A) Comply with the HACCP PLANs and procedures that are submitted as specified under § 8 201.14 and APPROVED as a basis for the modification or waiver; and (B) Maintain and provide to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY, upon request, records specified under ¶¶ 8 201.14(D) and (E) that demonstrate that the following are routinely employed; (1) Procedures for monitoring the CRITICAL CONTROL POINTS, (2) Monitoring of the CRITICAL CONTROL POINTS, (3) Verification of the effectiveness of the operation or process, and (4) Necessary corrective actions if there is failure at a CRITICAL CONTROL POINT.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; If you use a footnote as you have done you need an asterisks next to each food item that can be ordered and cooked less than the minimum required cook temperature. Such as Cheese Burger*, Avocado Burger*, Hoisin Glazed Mahi Mahi*, Cedar Plank Grilled Salmon* etc. Your disclosure and your reminder in the footnote are ok.
On your kids menu you have a Kids Burger. Hamburgers on a kids menu may not be served cooked less than 155 degrees, so it should not be included in the consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: A3-603.11 Your consumer advisory is missing the disclosure statement and you need an asterisk with each with each item that can be cooked less than the minimum cook temp. A proper consumer advisory includes a disclosure statement such as "*This item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11;(A), (B)(1)& (C) An attempt was made to do a consumer advisory in a footnote. A proper consumer advisory footnote has two parts a Disclosure such as:  This menu item is cooked to order and a Reminder such as:  Consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. You are missing the Disclosure. There should be an asterisk (*) next to each food item that customers have the option of ordering cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature and the footnote should be preceded by an asterisk (*).

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; The consumer advisory is OK for the burgers because the menu states that the burger is cooked to order. But the Seared Tuna does not say it is cooked to order.

a proper consumer Advisory has two parts   a reminder which you have and a disclosure such as: This item may be cooked to order. It would be better if both the disclosure and the reminder were in the foot note at the bottom of the page.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Your disclosure statement says something like "May contain raw or undercooked ingredients." If the food items were sushi or rare roast beef this might be OK as a disclosure statement. The asterisk is on items such as steak. These items are cooked to order so a  correct disclosure statement could be: Cooked to order; or This item may be cooked to order. The disclosure should explain why you need a reminder and yours is confusing.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; The consumer advisory is fine on both the lunch and the dinner Menes but there is not an asterisk next to items that may be cooked less than the required minimum  on the "Limited Time Only" (LTO) menu. Each time the LTO menu is changed the asterisks must be included if it is an item such as the TUSCAN SIRLOIN that may be cooked less than the reqiuired minimum cook temperature.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; A proper consumer advisory includes a disclosure such as "This item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. " You have a proper reminder but you need a disclosure statement.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Establishment has a consumer advisory in place asterisking menu items to a reminder statement.  No statement is present disclosing that foods may be served undercooked and reminder statement does not match required wording.  Recommend that specific corrections include: 1) reword phrasing of reminder to state "Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness" or another approved wording (capitalization not required); 2) include in the reminder footnote a statement that those items are "served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients."  Recommend that establishment draw up a draft of their intended consumer advisory revisions and contact inspector for approval prior to reprinting menus.  CDI by educating PIC.  3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Provide a consumer advisory for lightly cooked eggs. EHS provided information handout.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 (A) Except as specified in ¶ 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ¶ 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

THERE IS NO CONSUMER ADVISORY FOR THE SASHIMI.  ASTERISK ALL SASHIMI ON MENU AND INCLUDE CONSUMER ADVISORY THAT IS CLEARLY VISIBLE ON BOTH THE MENU AND AT SUSHI BAR. RECOMMEND USING OPTIONS 2 OR 3 UNDER ( C ) OF 3-603.11

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf-3-603.11 According to person in charge (PIC), establishment offers at least one undercooked animal-based food and has no or insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

[ if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or

comments: P - 7-204.11 - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) in sanitizing sink of 4-comp sink was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue). Concentration of  QA shall be 200-400 ppm. CDI by adding water to dilute sanitizer to proper concentration.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (steaks) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before  modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (steaks, tuna, planning on burgers) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before  modifying menu.  Please note that steaks are exempt only if certified by the vendor as from whole muscle, intact beef.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment found to offer raw or undercooked oysters and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority; Bleach disinfectant bottle was being stored over clean pans in clean dish storage. Ensure that chemicals are stored in designated areas away from utensils. Bottle was moved.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority; Bottle of bleach stored on shelf above prep table. Fly strips hung above food prep areas. Do not store chemicals above food or food contact surfaces. CDI-moved.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; There was one can of stainless steel cleaner on the second shelf in the cabinet with utensils at the bar. Store toxic cleaners away from food and food contact surfaces. shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; There was a bottle of degrees on a food prep sink. Store the degreaser with other cleaning solution and not on the food prep sink. (It was moved to the chemical storage area.)

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority; one container of Greased Lightening and a container of Isopropyl alcohol were stored on the shelf with seafood seasonings. These were moved to the chemical storage area under the 3 comp sink. POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS shall be stored so they can not contaminate FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. They can be stored in a different area.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Remove Raid insect spray from facility. For residential use only. Chemicals are to be used according to manufacturer's labeling. Voluntarily disposed of.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority - Found three chemical spray bottles hanging on tray close to clean utensils at 3-compartment sink. Chemicals shall be stored below and away from food, clean food equipment and utensils and food preparation surfaces. CDI by properly relocating chemicals.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority - Found bag of chips next to bottles of window cleaner. Also found bottle of sanitizer stored hanging over oven handle. Store chemicals below and away from food and clean food equipment and utensils.  CDI by properly storing chemicals.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority; Multi purpose cleaner stored in a prep sink. Bleach stored next to dried goods. Store all chemicals away from food, equipment, utensils, linens and single service articles.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority - In nearby storage room, found two large bottles of hand sanitizer stored above cans of food. Chemicals shall be stored below and away from food items. CDI by properly storing sanitizer.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-201.11; Priority Foundation; Butane torch stored with single service items at sushi bar and over food in the back; POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS shall be stored so they can not contaminate FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES by:  Locating the POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS in an area that is not above FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE or SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. This paragraph does not apply to EQUIPMENT and UTENSIL cleaners and SANITIZERS that are stored in WAREWASHING areas for availability and convenience if the materials are stored to prevent contamination of FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. Chemicals moved during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12- On the breader line top, bleach or heavily chlorinated cleaner had been used on the cutting board area of the unit, while food was still in the top of the cooler. The liquid residue under the cutting board was so strong that chlorine test strips used to check the liquid were immediately bleached out. Toxic chemicals may be used for cleaning food equipment but food and food contact surfaces need to be properly protected from contamination and should not be left in place in the unit when toxic chemicals are being used. The cutting board was removed and cleaned during inspection and the food in the top of cooler was discarded during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Found a large jug of household use insecticide under a prep table. The product is intended for household insecticide control, not restaurant use and should not be stored in the kitchen. If insects are a problem, a professional exterminator should be contacted. Jug was discarded during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Remove Hot shot pesticide from establishment. Use according to manufacturer's specifications.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; During inspection, employee used purple Fabuloso cleaner to spray down the prep table and cutting board after making sandwiches. The Fabuloso cleaner is not safe for use around food or food contact surfaces, it should not be used in food prep areas during regular operation. Wiping down food contact surfaces or cleaning food prep areas should be done using properly mixed sanitizer solution. CDI by educating employee and cleaning the cutting board during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; During inspection, undiluted bleach was being used to clean cutting boards and utensils but quat sanitizer was also being used at the sink. Strong fumes were present in this area. Quat sanitizer is ammonia based and when mixed with bleach, harmful gas can be formed which is dangerous for employees and customers in the area. Also, the accidental combination of chemicals could contaminate items being cleaned and sanitized at the sink. If bleach is being used, utensils and other items that are not being bleached should not be at the sink and quat sanitizer should not be used. Quat sanitizer was emptied during inspection and manager discussed chemical uses with dish washer during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; During inspection, excessive laundry detergent build up was observed on the agitator of the machine. Wiping cloths that are used to sanitize food contact surfaces are washed in this machine. Using excess detergent could lead to chemical contamination of wiping cloths. The washer agitator needs to be cleaned and make sure to use less detergent.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Pesticides may only be used if the label states that it may be used in a Food Establishment. Pesticides labeled 'for residential use only" may not be used.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; The chlorine sanitizer solution in buckets was extremely strong, according to test strips. Proper concentration for chlorine sanitizer is 50-200 ppm. When mixing sanitizer, follow the mixing instructions on the bleach bottle (2 teaspoons bleach per gallon of water) and always test the concentration with test strips after mixing. Solution was corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-202.12; Priority; Remove Ortho Home Defense. For residential use only. Remove from establishment.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-203.11/P; Sanitizer stored in Windex bottle in coffee area of restaurant. SANITIZING solutions shall not be stored in or dispensed from containers previously containing other POISONOUS OR TOXIC MATERIALS. Properly label chemicals. Discussed with employee.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-203.11 - Spray bottle that once was holding window cleaner was being re-used to hold chlorine sanitizer.  Spray bottles previously holding a toxic/poisonous chemical may not be used to holding sanitizer.  CDI-Education

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-203.11 - Spray bottle that once was holding window cleaner was being re-used to hold soapy water.  Spray bottles previously holding a toxic/poisonous chemical may not be used again.  CDI-Education

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment offers undercooked animal-based food (Hamburgers) and has no consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order)", and the disclosure asterisked to a reminder stating something like: “Consuming undercooked meats/hamburger may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” Please note that steaks are exempt only if certified by the vendor as from whole muscle, intact beef. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

Additional information available on the Wake County website at www.wakegov.com/food. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. (or approved equivalent)" Existing consumer advisory has asterisks and compliant reminder statement, but lacks any statement of disclosure.  Add statement to the effect of "May be cooked to order" or "May contain raw or undercooked ingredients." to either the individual item descriptions, or the reminder block at the bottom of the page.  Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment found to offer at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Eggs (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
