shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens  - Raw oysters and sushi-grade tuna offered for sale without approved consumer advisory.  Provide a consumer advisory at the point of selection informing consumers disclosing that these are raw items that may be consumed in undercooked form and including a reminder statement such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."  This consumer advisory replaces existing NC consumer advisory/shellfish warning.  The consumer advisory should be placed near the point of selection and have some visual tie (such as an asterisk on the product tag) tying the item to the advisory.  Contact your inspector for additional guidance or for approval of a proposed consumer advisory method.  CDI by this guidance.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens  - Consumer advisory not provided for undercooked items included in rodizio service (and brunch service, if eggs are cooked to order).  Provide consumer advisory notifying consumers of which items may be undercooked and the risks associated with this.  If the menu is provided at only one per table, recommend that both the menu be modified and table tents be provided.  One acceptable method for modifying menu is this: Place an asterisk by each gold and platinum header, and at "omelet station" if eggs may be undercooked to order.  At the bottom of the page, state:  "The beef, lamb, and eggs included in our rodizio and brunch service may be served raw or undercooked.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. "  A table tent may include similar wording.  Contact inspector with any questions or to have proposed wording approved prior to printing.  Implement consumer advisory within 10 days.  Item to be verified by follow up visit.

Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 There is an advisory but there is no asterisk (*) next to the food item that contains raw fish. On your sushi menu you need an asterisks (*) next to each sushi item that has raw fish or raw egg etc. Then at the bottom of the page or where ever your foot note is located, you need another asterisk (*) that says something like "*Contains Raw Fish, consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   (Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 I don't think your blanket statement meets the minimum for a consumer advisory.   Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a consumer advisory.  There are several ways to do the advisory. The food such as a hamburger should have an asterisks or other items that contains meat or eggs that can be ordered cooked less than the minimum cook temperature. Then at the bottom of the page  there should be another asterisks with a statement that says something like "these items may be cooked to order". Followed by "Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions."  (Handout given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Your consumer advisory does not meet all the requirements of the rule.    Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking (*)them to a footnote. The     Footnote should start with another asterisks. The footnote  must contain a disclosure such as *THESE ITEMS ARE COOKED TO ORDER. Then the disclosure statement is followed by the reminder : Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. ... FYI Also some places add a statement such as: Please inform your server if a person in your party has a food allergy.

comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food in raw or undercooked form but does not have insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC. Executive chef stated that new menus are starting on the 15th; Reference sheet provided on last inspection. Chef to email proof to EHS.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; current consumer advisory sign does not have all of the information required for the food code rules. manager was given our updated consumer advisory sign.
(A) Except as specified in ¶ 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ¶ 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Repeat Violation-A consumer advisory is posted at entrance to restaurant, however, no consumer advisory is on the menu for items offered undercooked such as lamb, duck, salmon, etc. A consumer advisory must be located on the menu so that customers can see it while ordering their meal. The consumer advisory has three parts: a reminder (in the form of an asterisk), and reminder statement (such as 'cooked to order' 'items offered undercooked' or 'item contains raw ingredients'), and a disclosure statement (which is what is currently posted at entrance). When menu is reprinted, add an appropriate consumer advisory statement to items offered undercooked. Operator stated that are reprinting the menu soon anyway. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Consumer advisory provided by the facility is insufficient. Facility is lacking disclosure. A consumer advisory must contain 3 parts. First portion being the indicator which alerts the consumer on which product is being undercooked. Next is the reminder which alerts the consumer that items are served undercooked and could potentially cause foodborne illness. Last is the disclosure which states "item is cooked to order" or in similar wording. The facility is missing the disclosure. I will follow up with violation until it is accommodated.
Exact rule wording below: B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (menu has been updated with "@" symbols on items served raw, and with reminder at bottom, but disclosure lacks part about item being served raw/undercooked). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. Approved Consumer Advisory must be provided by 9/20/13.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11;  Having a statement that says "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."  is not a complete consumer advisory. You need the name of the product followed by the disclosure and then a reminder. such as:    BEEF KABOBS are cooked to order. Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers several raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Remember that the consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE that states the food is cooked to order OR contains raw or undercooked ingredients. The disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by changing menus to reflect proper disclosure and reminder statements.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 (B)(2) . The menu was still not revised. It has the reminder at the bottom of one page, but no disclosure. You need to add a note that lets the customer know that sushi may contain raw fish. Please contact me before you print new menus. I can look at your proposed menu and correct it if needed before it goes to print. Anne Bartoli 919-868-9251
B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”;  or
(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - At least one raw or undercooked animal-based food is offered and only a reminder statement is on menu. A consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food. Consumer advisory must consist of asterisking or starring foods that are served raw or undercooked. On the menu, the asterisk refers to the DISCLOSURE statement, indicating that foods may be served raw or undercooked, followed by the following REMINDER statement: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." NOTE: All establishment menus, including on the internet, must include the proper consumer advisory. CDI by educating PIC about requirements...An example consumer advisory at bottom of menu would be:  *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked. Consumer raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; If you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory. You need a sign that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   Also on your sushi menu you need an asterisks (*) next to each sushi item that has raw fish or raw egg etc. Then at the bottom of the page you need another asterisk (*) followed by a disclosure such as *Our sushi contains raw fish. and then the reminder  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." .............
Instead of changing your menu you could do label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; An attempt was made to do a consumer advisory in a footnote. shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

FOOD packages shall be in good condition and protect the integrity of the contents so that the FOOD is not exposed to ADULTERATION or potential contaminants.

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated
comments: 3-202.15 ; Priority Foundation; Dented cans being held for credit were stored above other food for the establishment. One dented can was stored with other usable cans. Severely dented cans or cans that are dented at the top, bottom, or side seams cannot be used. When storing them for future credit, make sure to store them on a bottom shelf so they cannot contaminate any other food for the establishment. Relocate cans to a bottom shelf, segregated from all other food for the establishment.

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

If saving cans to send back to supplier, store them on a bottom shelf away from other food items. CDI-Relocated can to bottom shelf.

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated
comments: 3-202.15 ; Priority Foundation; There was one can of pineapple in the walk-in cooler that was going to be used for lunch that day. It had a dent in a side seam. Do not use cans that are dented on top, bottom, or side seams and if saving cans to be sent back for credit store them on a bottom shelf. CDI-Can discarded.

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (special oyster menu with raw oysters and dessert menu with tiramisu made with raw eggs had no consumer advisory; regular menu had items asterisked with a reminder but no disclosure, including Caesar dressing which does not need consumer advisory as facility uses pasteurized eggs). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 You have part of a consumer advisory but you are missing a disclosure statement and you need astericks (*) with each burger  and another with the disclosure. Then the reminder should follow the disclosure.   Items such as hamburgers may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a proper consumer advisory.   A proper consumer advisory includes a disclosure such as "This item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.  This would be located with the food item or in a footnote by asterisking (*) the food item and putting a footnote preceded by another asterisks(*).

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Consumer advisory is required in the facility since burger patties and shell eggs are offered undercooked.  There must be a notation on the food products offered undercooked and the consumer advisory to have them connected through information.  CDI-Information was given.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our tuna rolls contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; You need a proper  consumer advisory for the eggs if you offer to cook them less than the required minimum cook temperature of 140 degrees.  You could put up a sign  that says: EGGS   can be cooked to order. Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. .......  Also since your tuna sushi rolls are a raw product you need a consumer advisory for that product too. You could have a disclosure statement such as :Tuna rolls contain raw fish. Followed by a reminder such as: Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.   This could be on the product lable and or on a sign located at the self service sushi case.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 (A) Except as specified in ? 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ? 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ?? (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as ?oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),? ?raw-EGG Caesar salad,? and ?hamburgers (can be cooked to order)?; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

(B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:

(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Your consumer advisory placard is to broad (and it says the same thing twice. ) You need it on the menu with an asterisks by each item that may be cooked less than the required minimum required cooking temperature if the customer can order it that way. (Handouts given again.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked and a REMINDER statement.  For example:  Sushi* (asterisked to a disclosure and reminder at bottom of all menus that says:  *Denotes items that are served raw or undercooked or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.) Contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” Two alternate statements are available. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. Owner to correct consumer advisory and add it to the menu; educated on rules.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Eggs can be served raw or undercooked (any way), but a reminder statement is not posted. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food. A DISCLOSURE must be made by identifying the animal-derived foods by asterisking them to a footnote that states the items may be served raw or undercooked. A REMINDER includes asterisking the animal-derived foods requiring disclosure to a footnote that states: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." CDI by providing correct consumer advisory and posted. NOTE: An example of a correct consumer advisory statement on a menu would be as follows (after asterisking eggs on menu/ordering ticket that may be served raw or undercooked):  *Eggs are cooked to order. Consuming raw or undercooked eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness

Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Advisory handout provided. Followup to be done on 7/3.  At that time, be able to show what advisory language will be used, and give an approximate date of implementation.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 - PIC has draft of consumer advisory, but advisory has not been implemented.  When implementing, ensure that each raw fish or other raw meat item is asterisked to advisory statement at bottom of menu.  PIC has proposed the following wording: "  *Contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked seafood may increase your risk of foodborne illness.  "  This wording is approved, as it addresses both the reminder and disclosure portions of the advisory.  Follow up to be done on 7/3.  At that time, be able to give an expected implementation date for updated menus and sushi bar list.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: If an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw or undercooked,either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER.
B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”;
(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked.
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request;
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a consumer advisory.  Also if you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory for that also. You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   Also on your sushi menu you need an asterisks (*) next to each sushi item that has raw fish or raw egg etc. Then at the bottom of the page you need another asterisk (*)  that says "*Contains Raw Fish, consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   (Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Several raw or undercooked animal-based food (seafood, fish, etc.) are served and no consumer advisory is available. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based foods. First, a DISCLOSURE must be made by identifying the animal-derived foods by putting asterisks by them. The asterisk would refer to a footnote on menu that states the items may be served raw or undercooked. Then, a REMINDER statement would include the reason for identifying these foods as raw or undercooked. Not corrected during inspection. NOTE: An example of a correct consumer advisory statement on a menu would be as follows: *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked or may contain raw or undercooked ingredients. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-202.18; Priority; Bag of shellstock in the freezer with no tags.  PIC states that they are for personal use only and no clam dishes are listed on the menu. PLEASE NOTE:  due to the risk of illness associated with shellfish, all shellstock in a restaurant are required to have shellfish tags with the information required by the Food Code.  It is not an acceptable practice to have untagged shellfish for personal use in the establishment.  If untagged shellstock are found in this establishment again, points may be taken and the shellstock embargoed.  DISCARD THIS SHELLFISH OR REMOVE FROM THE FACILITY IMMEDIATELY.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-202.18; Priority Foundation;  Partial box of oysters has no tag.  PIC states that these do not meet their quality standards and were intended to be discarded.  Discard immediately if removing tag for filing.  CDI by discarding.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-202.18; Priority Foundation; PIC presented shell stock tags from the last 90 days(only 2 tag). One tag was not filled out and lacked vital information in regards to the Harvester. Ensure that upon shipment tags are as required per food code.(A) SHELLSTOCK shall be obtained in containers bearing legible source identification tags or labels that are affixed by the
harvester or DEALER that depurates, ships, or reships the SHELLSTOCK, as specified in the National Shellfish Sanitation Program Guide for the Control of Molluscan Shellfish, and that list: Pf
(1) Except as specified under ¶ (C) of this section, on the harvester's tag or label, the following information in the following order: Pf
(a) The harvester's identification number that is assigned by the SHELLFISH CONTROL AUTHORITY, Pf
(b) The date of harvesting, Pf
CDI-education

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-203.12(C)- Oysters and mussels are prepared and served in this facility. During inspection, 1 container of mussels and 1 container of oysters were found out of their original container and without an identification tag.  The identity of the source of SHELLSTOCK that are sold or served shall be maintained by retaining SHELLSTOCK tags or labels for 90 calendar days from the date that is recorded on the tag or label, as specified under ¶ B of this section, by: (1) Using an APPROVED record keeping system that keeps the tags or labels in chronological order correlated to the date that is recorded on the tag or label, as specified under ¶ B of this section; and (2) If SHELLSTOCK are removed from its tagged or labeled container:
(a) Preserving source identification by using a record keeping system as specified under Subparagraph (C)(1) of this section, and

(b) Ensuring that SHELLSTOCK from one tagged or labeled container are not COMMINGLED with SHELLSTOCK from another container with different CERTIFICATION NUMBERS; different harvest dates; or different growing areas as identified on the tag or label before being ordered by the CONSUMER. CDI by retrieving original tags from the office and placing them with the shellstock and discussed new tag retention system with chef and manager.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: Shellstock tags present, but stored loose in a bag that allows for them to fall from chronological order.  When the last shellstock is removed from a case: 1)The date when the last SHELLSTOCK from the container is sold or served shall be recorded on the tag or label;  2) Tags shall be retained for 90 days from the date recorded; and record keeping system shall keep the tags or labels in chronological order correlated to the date that is recorded on the tag or label.  CDI by this guidance.  Adjust record keeping to meet these guidelines.  3-203.12 Shellstock, Maintaining Identification

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Establishment offers steaks undercooked, with no consumer advisory on menu.  Steaks require consumer advisory unless it can be demonstrated at time of inspection that they have documentation stating that they are 'whole muscle, intact beef'.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by this guidance.

(Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Consumer advisory must be provided by 3/6/14. Return visit to be made to check consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Your tuna is a raw product.  If you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory. You could have a sign at the sushi counter that reads something like: "Our tuna rolls contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." ......If you have a sushi menu you need an asterisks (*) next to each sushi item that has raw fish or raw egg etc. Then at the bottom of the page you need another asterisk (*)  that says "*Contains Raw Fish, consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." ....... Another option would be to have a disclosue and a reminder on the packages that have raw fish such as: Contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

You may need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   Also on your sushi menu you need an asterisks (*) next to each sushi item that has raw fish or raw egg etc. Then at the bottom of the page you need another asterisk (*)  followed by  "*Contains Raw Fish. Consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness" OR "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions".  (Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-203.12 A) Except as specified under Subparagraph (C) (2) of this section, SHELLSTOCK tags or labels shall remain attached to the container in which the SHELLSTOCK are received until the container is empty. Pf
(B) The date when the last SHELLSTOCK from the container is sold or served shall be recorded on the tag or label. Pf

(C) The identity of the source of SHELLSTOCK that are sold or served shall be maintained by retaining SHELLSTOCK tags or labels for 90 calendar days from the date that is recorded on the tag or label, as specified under ¶ B of this section, by: Pf

(1) Using an APPROVED record keeping system that keeps the tags or labels in chronological order correlated to the date that is recorded on the tag or label, as specified under ¶ B of this section; Pf and
(2) If SHELLSTOCK are removed from its tagged or labeled container:
(a) Preserving source identification by using a record keeping system as specified under
Subparagraph (C)(1) of this section, Pf and

(b) Ensuring that SHELLSTOCK from one tagged or labeled container are not COMMINGLED with SHELLSTOCK from another container with different CERTIFICATION NUMBERS; different harvest dates; or different growing areas as identified on the tag or label before being ordered by the CONSUMER. Pf
TAGS ONSITE TODAY BUT NOT IN CHRONOLOGICAL ORDER. WRITE DATE SHELLSTOCK SOLD ON TAG AS WELL.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. comments: 3-603.11 You have attempted to do a consumer advisory but it is incomplete and not correct. Then at the bottom of the page there should be a footnote that starts with an asterisk and the footnote should include two parts a disclosure statement  such as "This menu item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Facility worked on Consumer advisory but it does not have "cooked to order or may contain raw ingredients". Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory reference sheet provided or consult with inspector on how to complete consumer advisory. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (egg yolk in soda, beef). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC (Wake County form provided at last inspection with instructions for writing consumer advisory). Consumer advisory must be provided by 4/17/14.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Menu's Consumer Advisory has correct REMINDER statement but is missing the DISCLOSURE statement. That states the asterisked items 'may be cooked to order'.  [DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as ?oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),raw-EGG Caesar salad, and hamburgers (can be cooked to order); Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. ].  CDI- Education on requirement.  Inspector will verify correction during Trans.Permit completion visit.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (Reminder is provided at Mongolian grill and at sushi station, but no disclosure is provided). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Sushi may be served raw or undercooked," or "Beef is cooked to order" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI-PIC edited consumer advisory for both stations.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Ceviche tropical on menu contains fish that is served raw. (the only animal origin food served raw or undercooked) on menu. Main menu shows that ceviche as part of the consumer advisory with an *. However, the disclosure statement says: "Foods cooked to order" but fish in ceviche is not cooked (heat treated) at all in this establishment. Therefore, menu should read: *Notice: Foods may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk for food borne illness..." CDI by informing PIC of requirement. When menus are changed, include the statements as mentioned above for correct consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; CONSUMER ADVISORY on the menu currently includes OMELETTES.  The Omelettes are likely not under-cooked. Monitor food temperature.  If Pooled EGG portion of the Omelettes are always cooked to at least 155F, remove the consumer advisory designation for THIS menu item.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Consumer advisory on most pages is compliant.  However, senior meals lack disclosure statement, and burger is offered with a consumer advisory on the children's menu.  All items offered undercooked must have a disclosure statement in addition to existing reminder notice.  This would include the words 'cooked to order', 'any style', or other indication of what foods are undercooked.  Also, per 3-401.11, comminuted meats on a children's menu (such as hamburger) shall not be offered with a consumer advisory.  Please correct these items within 10 days.  Correction may be made with edits to existing menus, such as addition of stickers, with table tents or other documentation, or by reprinting menus.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

"* Denotes items that are served raw or undercooked, and contain ( or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions."

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment offers fish/sushi & Steaks undercooked or raw and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Salmon (served raw or undercooked)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."   Proposed menu was evaluated today and suggestions made to bring it into compliance.  Management states that new menus will be printed with all parts of the consumer advisory on all pages.

(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;   REQRUIED FOR ANY ESTALBISHMENT THAT SERVES FOOD RAW OR UNDER COOKED: B) DISCLOSURE shall include: (1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or (2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf (C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states: (1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf (2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or (3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer hambrugers served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Disclosure is not properly printed in the menu or other conspicuous location. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

(Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  Follow up visit to be performed in 7 days.  At that time, be able provide a timeline for replacing or modifying menus.  Until menus can be replaced, recommend posting a sign or table tent listing items that may be undercooked and containing consumer advisory.  Example sheet provided.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 You have part of a consumer advisory but you are missing a disclosure statement and you need an asterisk (*) with each burger item and another with the footnote. A proper consumer advisory footnote includes a disclosure statement such as "This menu item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. ....Another option would be to remove the notice you have on the menu and cook everything to the required minimum cook temperature. Such as 145 degrees for eggs, fish, whole beef & pork. 155 degrees for ground and tenderized meat such as hamburgers. 165 degrees for poultry chicken/turkey /duck and stuffed foods.

Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, such as "Eggs (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." CDI by educating PIC about requirements.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - At least one raw or undercooked animal-based food (such as huevos rancheros) is offered in this facility, and consumer advisory is not complete on main menu (only reminder statement is provided and applicable foods are not asterisked) and no consumer advisory is available on take out menu. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food offered to customers with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." NOTE: Consumer advisory must be stated on all menus, including take-out and online menus. Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Establishment is marketing tuna marked as "Sashimi Tuna" and lacks Food Code compliant consumer advisory.  (Advisory equivalent to pre-Food Code shellfish warning present, as is consumer advisory regarding mercury.  While these may be required by other agencies or by corporate home office, neither of these are required as a part of this inspection.)  If marketing a seafood item as something that can/should be served raw or undercooked, post a consumer advisory compliant with Food Code.  One example of a compliant advisory would be: " Contains raw or undercooked ingredients.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. "  Some modification is allowed, such as removal of "poultry" and "eggs" if they are not served undercooked.  Recommend that any changes from example above be submitted to your inspector for review.  Follow up visit in 10 days.  At that time, be able to give an expected date of implementation and the advisory language that will be used.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: C - 2-201.11(A),(B),(C)&(E) Responsibility of Permit Holder, Person in Charge, and Conditional Employees - Person in charge (PIC) unable to provide documentation of an employee health policy that meets the requirements of the Rules.  Employees and conditional employees shall be notified of when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill.   The PIC is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate.   Sample employee health policy form can be found at www.wakegov.com/food .  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Provide consumer advisory for fajitas. Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens; Priority foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” Two alternate statements are available. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food in raw or undercooked form but does not have insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any animal-based food with the exception of some steaks that are served raw or undercooked. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. A reminder statement is currently included on main menu, but no disclosure statement is provided. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate which specific foods may be served raw or undercooked (asterisked foods and disclosure statement as mentioned below) and a REMINDER statement such as the following shall be used: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." CDI by educating PIC about requirements. EXAMPLE CONSUMER ADVISORY DISCLOSURE AND REMINDER STATEMENTS ARE AS FOLLOWS (which can be added at bottom of menu):  *These items may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. CDI by educating PIC about requirements.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: New Rule: 2-201.11(A), (B), (C), & (E) An Employee Health Policy is required to be signed by all employees and kept on the puchcart. The Person-In-Charge shall  notify employee when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill.   Sample employee health policy form can be found at www.wakegov.com/food. Click on 'New Food Rules' then click on 'Employee Health Policy'. Use Form 1-B.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-201.11(A), (B), (C), & (E) - Person in charge unable to provide documentation of an Employee Health Policy that meets the requirements of the Rules.  The Person-In-Charge shall  notify employee when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill.   The Person in Charge is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate. Sample employee health policy form can be found at www.wakegov.com/food .

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food (meat, seafood, etc.) and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. First, a DISCLOSURE must be made by identifying the animal-derived foods by asterisking them to a footnote that states the items may be served raw or undercooked. A REMINDER includes asterisking the animal-derived foods requiring disclosure to a footnote that states: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." CDI by informing PIC of requirements. NOTE: An example of a correct consumer advisory statement on a menu would be as follows (after asterisking the animal-derived foods on the menu that may be served raw or undercooked):  *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness

Follow up in 10 days. At that time, be able to demonstrate the consumer advisory that will be implemented and give a timeline for implementation.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection; failure to comply with consumer advisory requirements by next inspection will result in point deduction.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-201.11(A), (B), (C), & (E) Responsibility of Permit Holder, Person in Charge, and Conditional Employees -  Person in charge unable to provide documentation of an employee health policy that meets the requirements of the Rules.  Employees and conditional employees shall be notified of when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill.   The Person In Charge is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate.   Sample employee health policy form can be found at http://www.wakegov.com/food/healthinspections/resources/Pages/new_food_rules.aspx .  CDI by educating PIC.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

Employees and conditional employees shall be notified of when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill. The Person In Charge is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate. Sample employee health policy form can be found at www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC and providing optional Form 1-B. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; The items that are served raw or undercooked on the menu are not indicated by a symbol; The consumer advisory printed in the menu is sufficient to meet the requirements of the new NC Food Code. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC; email pictures or pdf of corrected menu to jennifer.edwards@wakegov.com.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Eggs are offered raw or undercooked in this establishment, and consumer advisory does not meet the rules (on blackboard and menus). Raw or undercooked animal-based foods are to be asterisked on menu, which refer to a DISCLOSURE statement that states the eggs are to be served raw or undercooked. A REMINDER statement is then required, reminding the consumer that the consumption of raw eggs may increase risk of foodborne illness. Not corrected during inspection. NOTE: A sample of disclosure and reminder statements are as follows (which can be included on bottom of menus): *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked. Raw or undercooked eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; there are three different menus. Left the manager a sample of how to word the consumer advisory, disclosure and where the asterisks need to be for the appropriate foods.
A) Except as specified in ¶ 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ¶ 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-201.11 (A), (B), (C),?and (E);- Person in charge failed to present adequate proof of Food Safety Manager education.  Each establishment shall have a person-in-charge present at all times that food is being handled.  This or another (present) person with supervisory duties shall have passed an ANSI approved Food Protection Manager test (such as Servsafe) and shall have the certificate available for review by the inspector.  Several different certificates are now approved.  Contact your inspector for more information.  Food Employee food safety and alcohol safety classes typically do NOT meet this requirement.   This item is currently in a phase in period and may be subject to loss of points starting on January 1, 2014.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

Add a disclosure stating eggs or hamburger can be cooked to order.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; The facility has a Consumer Advisory Reminder on the menu but it does not indicated which foods fall under the Consumer Advisory. Be sure to indicate which foods are offered at undercooked temperatures. Must disclose which foods are raw, undercooked, or cooked to order. Recommended using asterisks. State "Raw or under-cooked hamburgers, steaks and eggs, cooked to order, may increase your risk of foodborne illness".

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (eggs, hollandaise sauce, hamburgers, tuna, etc.). A consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks (if steaks can be verified to be whole intact muscle that have not been tenderized or injected). Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC of requirements.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Consumer advisory in place. However, some items lack disclosure statement. Ensure that each asterisked item contains a disclosure, such as "this item cooked to order", "Cooked to your liking", or "may contain raw or undercooked ingredients". Disclosure statements may be either in description of item or added to the consumer advisory block at the bottom. CDI by this guidance. Follow up visit in 10 days.  At that time, be able to provide estimated date of correction by manually editing menus or reprinting.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Establishment has a history of being in compliance with this item.  Follow up visit in 7 days.  At that time, be able to give an expected correction date.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Eggs and salmon steaks are cooked to order and no consumer advisory is available. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food. First, a DISCLOSURE must state the animal-derived foods may be served raw or undercooked. A REMINDER includes asterisking the animal-derived foods requiring disclosure to a footnote that states: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." NOTE: An example of a correct consumer advisory statement on a menu would be as follows (after asterisking the animal-derived foods on the menu that may be served raw or undercooked):  *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Several raw or undercooked animal-based food (meat, seafood, etc.) are served and no consumer advisory is available. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based foods. First, a DISCLOSURE must be made by identifying the animal-derived foods by putting asterisks by them. Then, a REMINDER statement would include the reason for identifying these foods as raw or undercooked. Not corrected during inspection. NOTE: An example of a correct consumer advisory statement on a menu would be as follows:  *Denotes items that may be served raw or undercooked or may contain raw or undercooked ingredients. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.

Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

If an item contains raw fish :*contains raw fish.(Some sushi places use a little fish instead of an asterisks.)  Then for items that the customer chooses how it is to be cooked that should be a different disclosure such as: **This item may be cooked to order etc.  (See example.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Facility has made new menus since the last inspection and failed to include the disclaimer stating 'Foods are cooked to order/Foods may be cooked to order" Will follow up with them on this issue until, violation is corrected. B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment offers raw or undercooked animal-based foods (raw salmon, raw tuna) and has no consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food. It consists of a DISCLOSURE, identifying the animal-based foods by asterisking them to a footnote that says they are served raw or undercooked. Advisory also includes a REMINDER, asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring disclosure to a footnote that states: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." Not corrected during inspection. Sample consumer advisory was provided during last visit.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; (B)(1) An attempt was made to do a consumer advisory in a footnote. A proper consumer advisory footnote has two parts a Disclosure such as: This menu item is cooked to order and a Reminder such as: Consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. You are missing the Disclosure with the foot notes. There should also be an asterisk (*) next to each food item that customers have the option of ordering cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
