shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-201.11 (A), (B), (C),?and (E); Core; Person in charge unable to provide documentation of an employee health policy that meets the requirements of the Rules. Employees and conditional employees shall be notified of when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill. The Person In Charge is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate. Sample employee health policy form can be found at www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Facility offers cooked to order steaks but does not contain a consumer advisory that backs this process. Menus shall be equipped with consumer advisory within 10 days. Menus shall contain : 1- An asterisk indicating which food is being cooked to order. 2- A disclaimer stating that food item is 'cooked to order' 3- A reminder displaying  Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness.
Have menus adjusted so that it meets code.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Menu has consumer advisory, but it is missing "Burgers may be cooked to order". Add this sentence beside burgers section of menu or you can asterisk every burger on menu with this sentence at the bottom of the page with consumer advisory. DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; or
(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients.
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness;  or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - According to PIC, eggs can be served raw or undercooked in establishment, but no consumer advisory was posted during breakfast period when eggs were served. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food. It must consist of a DISCLOSURE, identifying the animal-based foods by asterisking them to a footnote that says they may be served raw or undercooked. The advisory also includes a REMINDER, which includes asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring disclosure to a footnote that states: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Ceviche tropical on menu contains fish that is served raw. (the only animal origin food served raw or undercooked) on menu. Main menu shows that ceviche as part of the consumer advisory with an *. However, the disclosure statement says: "Foods cooked to order" but fish in ceviche is not cooked (heat treated) at all in this establishment. Therefore, menu should read: *Notice: Foods may be served raw or undercooked. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk for food borne illness..." CDI by informing PIC of requirement. When menus are changed, include the statements as mentioned above for correct consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; On menu that was reviewed during inspection, Caesar dressing and bearnaise sauce made with raw shell eggs, as well as cooked to order hamburgers were being offered. A reminder was printed in the menu but the disclosure and asterisk with the menu item were not printed. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. Discussed consumer advisory requirements with PIC. EHS will follow up on the consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf ? 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 - The facility sells sushi and does not have a consumer advisory. CDI - informed manager that one is needed. Provided information.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (beef and lamb) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Consumer advisory may be provided by "brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means."  Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed method of advisory approved prior to putting in place.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

(Alternate statement are available, ask you inspector if you have questions) CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at the next inspection; Corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; Several spray bottles labeled as sanitizer contained scented bleach or other substances that produced bubbles when the bottles were shaken. Scented bleach products are not registered sanitizers and should not be used. Also, make sure not to put any chemical other than bleach into sanitizer solution bottles. New bottles were used to mix fresh sanitizer.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; The quat sanitizer solution being dispensed at the 3 compartment sink was too strong according to test strips. Proper concentration for quat sanitizer is 200-400 ppm. It appeared that the dispenser was not properly calibrated. Until the dispenser can be properly adjusted, the solution may be diluted to reach appropriate concentrations. Solution was diluted during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer measured at over 500 ppm in sanitizer bottle. Quaternary sanitizer is hand mixed at this store from a concentrate. This is not being done correctly. Mix sanitizer following manufacturer's instructions and use test strips to verify that concentration is between 200-400 ppm. CDI-Inspector diluted sanitizer so that it was 300 ppm. If not in compliance on next inspection, 2-points will be taken.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; The sanitizer is too strong.  Be sure to properly mix the sanitizer. The bleach water should be 50 to 200 part per million. It only takes 3-5 drops of bleach for a spray bottle full of water.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Linen scented bleach was being used as a sanitizer. No bleach with perfumes or splashless bleach is approved as a sanitizer. Regular bleach only is to be used. Chemicals sanitizers must meet the requirements specified for food contact surface sanitizing solutions. CDI... An employee went to a stored and got regular bleach.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (eggs, beef steaks) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.   PLEASE NOTE:  this establishment has extensive additional menu listings on signs on the walls.  These items should be either marked directly with appropriate consumer advisory or an alternate means of providing advisory, such as table tents, should be used.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment found to offer at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (observed that burgers can be cooked to order according to menu).  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Since you  do cook eggs to order. Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way. You must provide a Consumer advisory for these items.( Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food that could be served in raw or undercooked form but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any animal-based food. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Facility found to be selling tuna that was labeled as "Sashimi Grade," this means that the tuna can be consumed raw or undercooked and is in a ready to eat form. When any fish, meat, poultry, eggs etc are offered as raw or undercooked in a ready to eat form, a consumer advisory must be provided. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (eggs) and has no consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.   Post signage at breakfast area menu stating: "Eggs cooked to order.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."  Item to be verified by followup visit in 10 days.  Existing dinner menu does not require consumer advisory if burgers are only served fully cooked.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: PF-3-603.11-Consumption of undercooked animal foodsC) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states: (2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood,shellfish or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or

(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Include this on your menus, menu boards. No consumer advisory for salmon that is undercooked or steak. Provide.

(B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means; educated on new rules; provided reference sheet.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to have no consumer advisory on menu, and offers burgers labeled as "cooked to temperature" which PIC states indicates that they are cooked to the customer's requested doneness.   Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks (those labeled by the vendor as "Whole-muscle, intact beef"). Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (or an approved alternate.)  Implement a consumer advisory or discontinue sales of burgers/steaks in an undercooked form. Followup visit to be performed in 10 days.  At that time, be able to demosntrate what consumer advisory method will be used, and provide a timeframe for implementation.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Consumer advisory provided, but with some errors.  Statement at bottom of menu provides approved reminder message, but only provides disclosure for steaks.  Steaks, burgers, turkey burgers, salmon are asterisked.   Determine which of these items will actually be offered undercooked, and ensure that they are covered by disclosure statement.  Recommend that items that will not actually be offered undercooked, such as turkey burgers, NOT be asterisked to statement on the bottom, as it may encourage a customer to order it undercooked.  As a reminder: Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."  Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed changes to wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.  Educational note:  childrens menu includes burgers, without a consumer advisory.  This is correct.  Undercooked comminuted meats, such as ground beef, shall not be offered on a childrens menu.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a consumer advisory.  Also if you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory for that also. You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."    ( Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a consumer advisory.  Also if you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory for that also. You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."    ( Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Consumer advisory for Sunday Brunch eggs provided on sign near expo passthrough.  Consumer advisory signage must be tied to specific menu items and should be handled via menu (or table tents).  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  Follow up to be performed on 4/19.  On that date, be able to provide wording that will be used and a timeframe for implementation.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (sushi has consumer advisory on menu but it is not visible for walk up orders). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11  PIC indicated he does not currently offer undercooked foods or more specifically burgers but is considering it.  If offered, a disclaimer as outlined in this section of the code and discussed in detail during the inspection must be displayed. CDI-education.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quat sanitizer well above 500ppm. Test strip turned bright blue. Keep sanitizer in safe range=between 200-300ppm. Sanitizer diluted to proper concentrations.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Menu contains warning to consumers about undercooked meats, but warning does not meet requirements of the Rules.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  Followup to be peformed on 4/26.  At that time, be able to provide draft consumer advisory and expected timeframe for implementation.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumer Advisory is incomplete.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food (i.e. eggs, hamburgers, steak, tuna) with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order), sashimi (contains raw fish)" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: ?Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.? Please note that steaks are exempt only if certified by the vendor as from whole muscle, intact beef. see also handout. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Each item that is cooked to order and could be cooked less than minimum required cook temperature must have an asterisk by that food item. .... (B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as ?oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),? ?raw-EGG Caesar salad,? and ?hamburgers (can be cooked to order)?; Pf or
(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Consumer advisory in place, but not compliant with requirements of the Rules (lacks disclosure statement on lunch/dinner menu and lacks asterisk on breakfast menu.)  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Followup visit to be performed on 5/3.  At that time, be able to indicate which wording will be used, which items will be marked, and provide a timeframe for compliance.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."    (Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue) in sanitizer buckets and in spray bottle. Concentration of QA shall be 200-400 ppm for type of QA sanitizer used. CDI by correcting QA sanitizer concentration.

shortdesc: Plumbing installed; proper backflow devices
comments: 5-205.15 (A); Repair leaking knobs on can wash area. All plumbing shall be in good repair.  Core;

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer at 3 compartment sink was below 150ppm. 150pm recommended by manufacturer. Get the dispenser checked to ensure it is working properly.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) in 3rd sanitizing sink of 3-compartment sink was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue). Concentration of QA shall be 200-400 ppm for type of QA sanitizer used. CDI by adjusting sanitizer to correct concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Chlorine sanitizer was too strong. Water was mixed with solution to bring concentration down to 200 ppm. All chlorine sanitizer shall be 50-200 ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer well above 400ppm in bottles. CDI-diluted to proper strength.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; The quat sanitizer solution at the 3 compartment sink was too strong according to test strips. Proper concentration for quat sanitizer is 200-400 ppm. Until the dispenser can be adjusted or repaired, the solution can be diluted by adding fresh water. Make sure to check the solution concentration to insure that it is the right strength before sanitizing dishes.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; sanitizer in the spray bottle was too strong. This was corrected during inspection to 50-100 ppm for Clorox.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11  Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue) in spray bottles. Concentration of  QA shall be 200-400 ppm. CDI by adjusting to correct concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 . The sanitizer dispensed at the dish sink is at 500 ppm or more according to the test strips. Have the dispenser adjusted. Chemical SANITIZERS and other chemical antimicrobials applied to FOOD-CONTACT SURFACEs shall meet the requirements specified in 40 CFR 180.940 Tolerance exemptions for active and inert ingredients for use in antimicrobial formulations (food-contact surface sanitizing solutions).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quat sanitizer was too strong when checked. Sanitizer was over 500 ppm. Sanitizer water temp was 140 degrees and rising. Ensure that quat sanitizer is between 200-400 ppm, and per instructions sanitizer temp shall be between 65-85 degrees. Corrected sanitizer was made during the course of the inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 . The sanitizer in the dish sink was at 500 ppm. Sanitizer was at 98 F. Made a fresh batch of sanitizer using cold water only, and concentration dropped to 400 ppm ( cold water is still at 88 F ). Do not make this type of sanitizer with hot water. Too much concentrate gets dissolved off the block.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; The sanitizer was too strong. Be sure to mix it correctly. It should be in the range of 50-200 parts per million chlorine. It only takes 3-5 drops of bleach for a spray bottle full of water. (I dumped most  it out and refilled it with water and it is about 200 parts per million bleach water.)

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer is over 400ppm of quaternary ammonium in a wiping cloth bucket. Use 200-400ppm of quaternary ammonium.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority;  Two Spray bottles of sanitizer (chlorine) over 200 ppm. Chlorine sanitizer concentration must be maintained between 50-200ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Chemical sanitizer must be a correct concentration levels. Chlorine sanitzer was above 200 ppm. Should be betwenn 50-100 ppm. Diluted during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in two spray bottles tested over 400 ppm. Maintain at approved concentration. CDI-bottles sent to be refilled with properly mixed sanitizer.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; 1 BUCKET OF SANITIZER LESS THAN 200PPM QUAT. KEEP 200-300PPM. RECOMMEND SOAKING CLEAN RAG IN SANITIZER VAT OF DISHSINK BEFORE ADDING TO BUCKET. ALSO CHANGE AS NEEDED.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; 1 SANITIZER BUCKET LESS THAN 200PPM. KEEP 200-300PPM. BUCKET DUMPED.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; The bleach water sanitizer is very strong in the spray bottle. When I sprayed it on the strip it it turned dark and then back to white. The test strip should be blue to navy blue. It only takes about 3-5 drops of bleach for a spray bottle. The best way to mix a bottle is to get it from the sink when you make sanitizer for the dishes.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Chlorox splashless concentrated bleach is not approved for sanitizing food contact surfaces. Use approved chemical for sanitization. CDI by educating manager.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Chlorox splashless concentrated bleach is not approved for sanitizing food contact surfaces. Use approved chemical for sanitization. CDI by educating manager.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; 101 Bleach used for sanitizing does not appear to be approved for this purpose. Need to get sanitizer approved for sanitizing. CDI-educated manager. This will be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: P - 7-204.11 - In spray bottle, chlorine bleach sanitizer was greater than 200 ppm (test strip turned black and then started to turn white). Concentration of bleach water sanitizer shall be 50-200 ppm. CDI by diluting sanitizer for correct concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in dish sink measured over 500 ppm quaternary ammonium. Maintain at approved concentration. CDI-sanitizer remixed at approved concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; SANITIZER UNDER SLICERS LESS THAN 200PPM. KEEP AT REQUIRED CONCENTRATIONS. BE SURE TO RUN SANITIZER AT DISPENSER LONG ENOUGH TO PUSH SANITIZER SOLUTION THROUGH UNIT BEFORE PUTTING CONTAINER UNDER HOSE.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer being drained from utensil sink at beginning of inspection tested over 500 ppm. No utensils were being sanitized at this time. Maintain at approved concentration - may need to adjust dispenser. CDI-discussed requirement with PIC, who remade sanitizer at proper concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: P - 7-204.11 - Chlorine sanitizer in spray bottles and wiping cloth bucket was greater than 200 ppm (test strips bleached out). Concentration of chlorine bleach sanitizer shall be at least 50 ppm but should not exceed 200 ppm. CDI by adjusting sanitizer to proper concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in spray bottles tested over 200 ppm chlorine (test strip turned black). Maintain at 50-200 ppm. CDI-sanitizer remade.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in spray bottle and dispensing from dispenser on wall less than 200ppm. Quat testing at 100ppm. Dispenser adjusted before REHS departed.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer mixed at time of inspection less than 50ppm chlorine. Chlorine added to bottle to produce 50-100ppm chlorine.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in sanitizing vat of dishsink less than 150ppm. Keep 150-200ppm. When new sanitizer dispensed it's coming out at 150ppm. Recommend increasing concentration to 200-300ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer tested over 200 ppm chlorine (maintain 50-200 ppm). CDI-sent to be diluted.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Place an asterick next to the the hamburger on the menu.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Bleach sanitizer was over 400 ppm. Bleach bottle was remade by inspector so that it was in adequate range. All bleach sanitizer shall be 50-200 ppm. Also label all chemical bottles with common working name.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 3-in-1 oil used for can opener and as a general lubricant is not approved for use on food contact surfaces. Use only lubricants that are approved for use on food contact surfaces.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-206.11; Priority; Raid insecticide being used for Kangaroo insect control. Insecticide labeled for residential use only. Do not use for establishment.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-207.11- A bottle of ibuprofen was found on the back of the salad/cold app prep cooler. Medicines that are in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT for the EMPLOYEES' use shall be labeled as specified under § 7 101.11 and located to prevent the contamination of FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES. Ibuprofen was moved during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-207.11; Priority; RUBBING ALCOHOL AND MOUTH WASHES STORED BESIDE FOOD CONTACT SURFACES. STORE MEDICINES IN A MANNER TO PREVENT CONTAMINATION OF FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS,LINENS, AND SINGLE SERVICE ITEMS.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: P - 7-207.11 and 7-208.11 - Observed a few bottles of medicines, hand sanitizers and first aid items stored above food preparation areas. Store all personal medications and first aid items below and away from food, food preparation areas and clean food equipment/utensils. CDI by properly relocating these items.

Store all personal medications and first aid items below and away from food, food preparation areas and clean food equipment/utensils. CDI by properly relocating these items.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-207.11; Priority; Do not store medication (otc pain medication) above foods or food contact surface (steam table next to prep cooler).

comments: 7-207.11; Priority; Day quill stored above make line. Store chemicals where if they spill they will not contaminate food or food contact surfaces.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

comments: 7-207.11; Priority;  Employee medications stored on shelf under prep table.   Store employee medications in a location that prevents the contamination of foods, utensils, single use items, clean linens, etc.  CDI by moving.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer hambrugers served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Disclosure is not properly printed in the menu or other conspicuous location. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection. ***Failure to meet consumer advisory requirements for undercooked hamburgers will result in point deduction during next inspection.***

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11  (A) Except as specified in ¶ 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ¶ 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf CDI Education

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (eggs). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Eggs (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

See the code for specifics.  CDI-education.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-501.17- Incorrect or no date marking observed. Ready to eat, potentially hazardous foods kept in the establishment more than 24 hours shall be date marked. Date marking should be either a preparation date, or a consume-by/discard date. If foods are maintained at 41F or below they may be held up to 7 days; if holding between 41F and 45F, foods may only be held up to 4 days. Certain foods are exempt from this requirement. Contact your inspector if you have questions about whether a specific item must be date marked. CDI by educating PIC; follow up for date marking during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Menu does not have Disclosure.  Provide both DISCLOSURE AND REMINDER STATEMENTS ON THE MENU FOR FOODS THAT ARE COOKED TO ORDER. CDI - Education
(A) Except as specified in ? 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ? 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ?? (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as ?oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),? ?raw-EGG Caesar salad,? and ?hamburgers (can be cooked to order)?; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority - Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) in all spray bottles was greater than 400 ppm (test strips turned blue). Concentration of QA shall be 200-400 ppm according to instructions on sanitizer concentrate bottle. CDI by adjusting to proper sanitizer concentration in these bottles.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quat sanitizer was to strong.  Quat Sanitizer was above 400 ppm.  Quat sanitizer shall be between 200 ppm and 400 ppm.  CDI-Sanitizer was remade to proper strength.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue) in two sanitizer spray bottles. Concentration of QA shall be 200-400 ppm. CDI by discarding bottle in liquids and filling with sanitizer of proper strength.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority - Chlorine sanitizer in wiping cloth bucket was great than 200 ppm (test strip started bleaching out). Concentration of chlorine bleach sanitizer shall be at least 50 ppm but should not exceed 200 ppm. CDI by adjusting sanitizer to proper concentration.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in all spray bottles measured at well over 400 ppm. Sanitizer concentration must be maintained between 200-400 ppm for food-contact purposes. Upon further inspection the directions for use were for a sanitizer solution of 660 ppm. For food-contact purposes, mix sanitizer with less concentrate than currently using and use available test strips to make a solution that is the correct concentration (200-400 ppm). CDI-Educated operator and to use lower (correct) concentration and pointed out that manufacturer's instructions explicitly say 660 ppm, for disinfection (not sanitization) levels.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; All wet wiping cloth buckets had quaternary sanitizer that was well over 400 ppm. Manager stated that they had recently switched chemical companies and that could be why they were all high. Sanitizer in too high a concentration is not rated for food contact and is toxic. Quaternary sanitizer must be mixed to be between 200-400 ppm. CDI-Manager diluted all buckets so they were the proper concentration. Have your employees use test strips to make sure sanitizer is correct concentration. Recommend acquiring test strips that are easier to distinguish correct concentration levels with. The current test strips are not easy to read. When mixing sanitizer and using current test strips to ensure proper concentration aim for green, not blue color.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; One of the buckets of sanitizer was very strong, over 500 parts per million (ppm). (The dispenser is dispensing at the proper strength so I'm not sure what happened. The employee dumped it out and refilled the sanitizer and it is good now.)

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) in spray bottle was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue). Concentration of the QA used in this establishment (according to product label) shall be at least 200 ppm but should not exceed 400 ppm. CDI by adjusting sanitizer concentration in bottle.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11, Priority  The quaternary ammonium sanitizer in a spray bottle is over 400ppm of quaternary ammonium. Use 200-400ppm of quaternary ammonium.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; sanitizer bottle too strong. This bottle was remade to the correct concentration for chlorine which is 50-200 ppm.  Sanitizer concentrations shall be made to the correct concentration for the chemical used.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Consumer advisory printed in the menu was not adequate to meet new rule requirements. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- The consumer advisory printed in the menu is not sufficient to meet the requirements of the new NC Food Code. . Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection. *Failure to meet consumer advisory requirements by next inspection will result in point deduction.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least eggs and hamburgers cooked to order and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; No HACCP plan was present at restaurant to be provided upon request. HACCP logs were kept, in chronological order, but the HACCP plan itself was not able to be provided to the Health Inspector. HACCP plan must always be available for the Regulatory Authority, upon request. Acquire a copy of the HACCP plan.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Manager on Duty was unable to retrieve data logger data. There was a data logger present, so that is an improvement since last inspection, but it needs to be functional. Make sure data can be retrieved and that all managers are trained on retrieving said data at next inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; All June HACCP logs were reviewed today. Cooling logs were missing or incomplete for 6/10 and 6/23. Cooling logs are not being completed to show that food is cooling from 135 F to 70 F within 2 hours and from 70 F to 41 F within an additional 4 hours. Cooling logs must be completed until product cools to 41 F and food must cool from 135 F to 70 F within 2 hours and from 70 F to 41 F within an additional 4 hours. Complete logs for the next 10 days accurately and email them to your health inspector at johanna.hill@wakegov.com OR text message them to (919)280-3216. If logs are still not being completed or are not emailed/texted to inspector in that time frame an intent to suspend your permit will be issued. Elizabeth Freeman did record these discrepancies in Olive Garden's 'Red Book' Manager Log.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: As a method of FOOD preservation, To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS.   Information Given along with request form.
Go to  http://ehs.ncpublichealth.com/faf/food/correspondence.htm  for more information  for obtaining a variance.
http://ehs.ncpublichealth.com/faf/food/correspondence.htm

comments: 8-201.13  The cook / chill process using ROP packaging is still in use but there is no HACCP plan on site for review and none has been submitted to the state.  This process requires a variance and all variances will require a detailed HACCP plan.  Otain the plan from corporate and keep it on file for review so inspectors can determine if the plan is being followed accurately.  Temperature logs are being filled out and the data suggests the process is working well.  Continue the process unless otherwise directed by the department.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 - PIC states that establishment will undercook beef kabobs at customer request and no consumer advisory is posted.  Temperature threshold for avoiding consumer advisory is 145 degrees F for 15 seconds.  If cooking process meets this temperature/time combination, no advisory is necessary.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 No consumer advisory posted regarding undercooked eggs or hamburgers; PIC needs to make a sign warning consumers about eating raw or undercooked food; PIC to follow up with EHS on sign.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a consumer advisory.  Also if you serve sushi that is not cooked you need a Consumer Advisory for that also. You need a sign at the sushi bar that reads something like: "Our sushi contains raw fish.  Consuming raw or undercooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness."    (Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

You must provide a Consumer advisory for these items. ( Consumer Advisory handouts given.)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 - PIC states that establishment will serve undercooked eggs on request, and no consumer advisory present.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: C - 8-201.13 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (reduced oxygen packaging (ROP) of raw meat, cheeses, etc.) but no approved HACCP plans are in place. (NOTE: According to Section 3-502.12(C) in the NC Food Code Manual, except for fish that is frozen before, during and after packaging, a food establishment may not package fish using a reduced oxygen packaging method.) This specialized process requires a HACCP plan but NOT a variance. Submit to your inspector the documentation of your HACCP plan for the above ROP activites, following the requirements of 8-201.14 which includes the contents of a HACCP plan. Also refer to 3-502.12 for other information. CDI by informing PIC of requirement.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; No HACCP plan available for making yogurt; Before engaging in an activity that requires a HACCP PLAN, a PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall submit to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY for approval a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 8 201.14 and the relevant provisions of this Code if: (1) Submission of a HACCP PLAN is required according to LAW;

(2) A VARIANCE is required as specified under Subparagraph 3-401.11(D)(4), ? 3 502.11, or ? 4 204.110(B); (3) The REGULATORY AUTHORITY determines that a FOOD preparation or processing method requires a VARIANCE based on a plan submittal specified under ? 8 201.12, an inspectional finding, or a VARIANCE request.  (B) A PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall have a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 3 502.12For a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that is required under ? 8 201.13 to have a HACCP PLAN, the plan and specifications shall indicate:

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (performing reduced oxygen packaging) that falls outside of the normal limits set by the Rules. A process such as this requires that a variance be obtained and that a HAACP plan be put in place. If practicable, recommend that establishment discontinue this process. If this process is necessary for operation of the establishment, email documentation of the process, including all ingredients and procedures, to your inspector within 10 days. Additional guidance will be provided by your inspector once a framework has been set up to handle variances and HAACP plans. Submittal of procedure within 10 days or discontinuance of process will be considered correction in the meantime.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: Pf - 3-502.11 - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (acidifying rice) for sushi rice, which falls outside the normal limits set by the Rules. Specialized processes require that a variance be obtained and a HAACP plan be put in place. According to manager, a variance request with all applicable documentation has been submitted to variance committee but no variance approval has been obtained. NOTE: Remember that the pH of sushi rice must be BELOW 4.2, NOT 4.2 or below. Observed in pH log that pH was 4.2 and 4.3 on a few past dates and no corrective action was documented. Ensure pH is always less than 4.2 and document all corrective actions, such as the addition of more vinegar and retesting the pH. CDI by informing PIC of requirement.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 Prior to 9/01/12 your sushi rice acidification process was approved but now a variance is required.   A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in ? 8 103.10 and under ? 8 103.11 before: Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: As a method of FOOD preservation, To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS.   Go to  http://ehs.ncpublichealth.com/faf/food/correspondence.htm  for more information  for obtaining a variance. ...Another option would be to quickly cool the rice from 135 to 70 with in two hours and then from 70  down to 41 degrees or colder with in 4 hours more and use the cold rice to make the rolls or make the rolls with warm rice and cool the rolls down to 41 degrees with in the time limit.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Prior to 9/01/12 your sushi rice acidification process was approved but now a variance is required. A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in  8 103.10 and under  8 103.11 before: Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: As a method of FOOD preservation, To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS. Go to http://ehs.ncpublichealth.com/faf/food/correspondence.htm for more information for obtaining a variance. ...Other  options that do not require a variance would be to quickly cool the rice from 135 to 70 within two hours and then from 70 down to 41 degrees or colder within 4 hours more and use the cold rice to make the rolls or make the rolls with warm rice and cool the rolls down to 41 degrees within the time limit.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 CONSUMER ADVISORY NEEDS TO BE POSTED AT FRONT MENU AREA. HAMBURGERS AND EGGS MAY BE COOKED TO ORDER. REHS PROVIDED SIGNAGE TO POST UNTIL FACILITY CAN MAKE IT'S OWN SIGN. PUT AN ASTERISK BESIDE EACH FOOD THAT MAY BE COOKED TO ORDER.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC and providing Wake County form with information on writing consumer advisory. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment offers eggs cooked to order and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.   Guidance form provided.  Follow up in 7 days.  At that time, be able to explain consumer advisory that will be used and give date for full implementation.

(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as ?oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),? ?raw-EGG Caesar salad,? and ?hamburgers (can be cooked to order)?; Pf or

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility using nitrates in curing meat and facility does not have a HACCP Plan or variance; manager tossed curing substance into trash; A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Pf

(A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; (B) Curing FOOD; (C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: (1) As a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement, or (2) To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL OF SAFETY FOOD); (D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12; (E) Operating a MOLLUSCAN SHELLFISH life-support system display tank used to store or display shellfish that are offered for human consumption; (F) Custom processing animals that are for personal use as FOOD and not for sale or service in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT; (G) Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; or (H) Sprouting seeds or beans; Educated on rules.

A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before:
(B) Curing FOOD;

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility was using UV fans on freshly cut pork sink in prep area. These fans were used to reduce the moisture for the process of turning raw cut pork skins into harden/cooked pork skins. This process is considered specialized and shall not be continued. Gave options to the PIC on how to accommodate this issue. Stated that fan usage to take moisture out of this product can be done in the walk in cooler where its 45 degrees and below at all times or moisture can be reduced by slow cooking the product. If that does not suffice PIC can try and obtain a variance to carry on their process from our HACCP team/state department. A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Pf
(A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; Pf
(B) Curing FOOD; Pf
(C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: Pf
PIC stated that they will continue this process in the walk in cooler.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (a few items cooked to order not asterisked on grill menu; improper disclosure). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. Provide consumer advisory to inspector within ten days (by 8/18/13).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; several chlorine sanitizer buckets were too strong today >100 ppm. These were remade to 50-100 ppm for chlorine bleach. Sanitizers shall be made to the correct concentration for the chemical used.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; The bleach water sanitizer is too strong. Be sure to properly mix the sanitizer so it is 50-200 parts per million bleach water. The test strips should turn blue or navy blue. When it is mixed too strong the paper turns navy blue and then turns back to white.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer in 2 spray bottles too strong. Bleached out chlorine test strip. Keep sanitizer within required concentrations. Sanitizer diluted.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; PROHIBITS THE BOTTLE OF QUAT SANITIZER TESTING HIGHER THAN 400PPM.  PRODUCT EMPTIED

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; The spray bottle labeled as sanitizer was too strong, according to test strips. Proper concentration for quat sanitizer solution is 200-400 ppm. The bottle of sanitizer concentrate actually registered at a safe concentration. The solution in the spray bottle was properly diluted during inspection.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; The bleach water in the spray bottle should be 50-200 parts per million (ppm) just like it is in the sink, but it is very very strong. When I sprayed it on the strip the strip turns white instantly, it should be blue or navy blue.  If you need a strong bleach water it is fine but you would need to label it as such and still provide a properly mixed bottle or bucket of sanitizer that is 50-200 ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority; The bottle labeled as kitchen bleach, which was identified as sanitizer solution was too strong according to test strips. Proper concentration for bleach and water sanitizer is 50-200 ppm. Bottle should be also be labeled as "sanitizer".

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Sanitizer inside a spray bottle was not diluted and was likely pure quaternary ammonia concentrate as it measured at over 500 ppm. At this concentration sanitizer is not rated for food-contact surfaces and is toxic. Sanitizer must be mixed to be between 200-400 ppm. Sanitizer can easily be dipped from accurately dispensing 3-compartment sink. CDI-Diluted bottle. If not in compliance on next inspection, 2-points will be taken.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; The sanitizer in the spray bottle was too strong. The directions say 1-2 tablets per gallon to make the quaternary ammonia (QAC) sanitizer 200-400 parts per million (ppm).

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quat sanitizer was well above 400ppm. CDI-diluted.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; bleach was too strong today. Manager did not realize that when the strip turns black then white, it was too strong. Educated manager on this today. Clorox sanitizer concentration was remade to 50-200 ppm.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11; Priority - Quaternary ammonium sanitizer (QA) in one spray bottle was greater than 400 ppm (test strip turned blue). Concentration of  QA shall be 200-400 ppm. CDI by discarding contents of bottle.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11;The sanitizer in the spray bottle was very strong. The QAC sanitizer must be in the range of 200-400 parts per million. Be sure to properly mix the sanitizer. It is best to get the sink mixed correctly and then dip the bottles and buckets out of the sink and change it out every day.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Disinfectant was being used to wipe countertops. Only sanitizer in adequate concentrations shall be used to clean food contact surfaces such as dinning tables and counter tops. Refrain from using disinfectant for sanitizing usage. Refrain from storing chemicals over single service articles. CDI-education.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-204.11 ; Priority; Quaternary sanitizer was dispensing at over 500 ppm. Quaternary sanitizer must be mixed to be between 200-400 ppm. CDI-Until dispenser is repaired (likely just needs a smaller dosing tip) dilute the sanitizer 50% with cold water.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 - The facility has started putting a HACCP Plan for using Reduced Oxygen Packaging on raw steak, raw pork, and raw chicken. The HACCP plan is not currently up to regulation standards. The HACCP Plan must meet criteria of an approved HACCP Plan. CDI - The managers are signed up for a course in October that teaches how to properly produce an approved HACCP Plan under the NC FOOD CODE.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12 (A) . The facility uses vacuum sealed bags for cooling of leftovers. This procedure now requires a HACCP plan as well as a variance. If a variance and a HACCP plan have been submitted or approved, the restaurant needs a copy of both on hand. To avoid having to apply for either one, use zip lock bags for cooling ( or open pans in ice ). You will still have to follow the cooling parameters of cooling from 135 F to 70 F in 2 hours, and 70 F to 45 F in another 4 hours.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
