shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; No HACCP plan for using Nitrites in brine for pastrami; Before engaging in an activity that requires a HACCP PLAN, a PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall submit to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY for approval a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under § 8 201.14 and the relevant provisions of this Code if: (1) Submission of a HACCP PLAN is required according to LAW;

(2) A VARIANCE is required as specified under Subparagraph 3-401.11(D)(4), § 3 502.11, or ¶ 4 204.110(B); (3) The REGULATORY AUTHORITY determines that a FOOD preparation or processing method requires a VARIANCE based on a plan submittal specified under § 8 201.12, an inspectional finding, or a VARIANCE request.

(B) A PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall have a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under § 3 502.12For a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that is required under § 8 201.13 to have a HACCP PLAN, the plan and specifications shall indicate. Facility instructed to stop using Nitrites until variance & HACCP plans have been approved by this department. Educated on rules.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; B)Your  consumer advisory is not complete.  You have a reminder for the salmon and for hamburgers but you are missing the disclosure such as: "These items may be cooked to order."

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: A3-603.11 Your consumer advisory is missing the disclosure statement and you need an asterisk with each with each item that can be cooked less than the minimum cook temp. A proper consumer advisory includes a disclosure statement such as "*This item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11;(B) An attempt was made to do a consumer advisory in a footnote. A proper consumer advisory footnote has two parts a Disclosure such as: This menu item is cooked to order and a Reminder such as: Consuming raw or under cooked meats, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. You are missing the Disclosure. There should be an asterisk (*) next to each food item that customers have the option of ordering cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Your disclosure statement is too broad. It doesn't really disclose anything. For an item that is served RARE such as roast beef the disclosure could be (***)Our Roast Beef is served rare. Etc.  An asterisk does not have to be a (*) it could be another sign like was done for your gluten free items.

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used

"Medicines that are in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT for the EMPLOYEES' use shall be labeled as specified under § 7 101.11 and located to prevent the contamination of FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES."

shortdesc: Toxic substances properly identified, stored, & used
comments: 7-207.11; Priority; Medications stored among dry goods at dry goods shelving.  Store medications to prevent contamination of foods, utensils, single use items, etc.  Keep at manager desk area or other area not used for storage of foods, etc.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;Establishment offers ceviche and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as ?Hamburger (cooked to order),? and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: ?Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.? (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before  modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Facility has added consumer advisory but has asterisks where not indicated (sliders and philly steak) as the items are not cooked to order. Also, undercooked tuna has been added to the menu and needs an advisory. May email or fax adjusted menu to EHS or EHS will return on Friday September 20th for verification. (Mgr provided a corrected copy of menu that meets requirements before EHS left facility. Facility intends to print new menus immediately for menu changes-status changed to CDI)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  There still is no consumer advisory posted for raw or under cooked animal products.  The operator says he has the information he needs and understands the requirement and will have it on the new menus he plans to have printed soon.  CDI-education.  Points will be deducted for future non-compliance.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; The restaurant now serves sushi and there was no consumer advisory posted.  Fish and shellfish served or sold raw,undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in Ready-To-Eat form or as ingredients in another Ready-To-Eat-Form must post a consumer advisory. CDI... A form was left with the manager.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Cosnumer Advisory on the printed menu needs to be expanded to include the designation/identification of which menu items it pertains to (i.e. eggs and steak) and also to include the description (i.e. can be cooked to order) = Disclosure.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory on new menu (animal products which can be served raw/undercooked are asterisked only - no disclosure that they may be served raw/undercooked, and menu has reminder at bottom of first tri-folded page only - second page has asterisked items as well, and add-on sides with dot which could be confused with asterisk). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; REQUIRES THE FACILITY TO INIDCATE ON THE REMINDER THAT THE ASTERISKED ITEMS CAN BE COOKED TO ORDER AS STATED IN (2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients....THIS CAN BE DONE BY PLACING THIS STATEMENT AT THE BOTTOM OF THE MENU WITH THE WARNING STATEMENT OF CONUSMING RAW OR UNDERCOOKDE FOODS.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Salmon Sushi Roll" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Items such as as eggs , fish and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a proper consumer advisory.   A proper consumer advisory includes a disclosure such as "This item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.  This would be located with the food item or in a footnote by asterisking (*) the food item and putting a footnote preceded by another asterisks(*).

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Establishment has recently begun offering burgers cooked to order but does not have a conumer advisory.  Requirements were disscussed at length and reviewed on page 98 of the food code manual. Use this resource as a guide to compliance when making the new menus. Plans to replace the current menus was already in place so the advisory should be added.  CDI-education.  Offering of undercooked burgers should cease until the proper advisory has been added.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (Reminder is provided at Mongolian grill and at sushi station, but no disclosure is provided). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Sushi may be served raw or undercooked," or "Beef is cooked to order" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Consumer advisory on menu, but has no disclosure statement and does not explicitly warn consumers of danger of eating undercooked items.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.   Example sheet provided.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer hambrugers served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Disclosure is not properly printed in the menu or other conspicuous location. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection. ***Failure to meet consumer advisory requirements for undercooked hamburgers will result in point deduction during next inspection.***

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; CONSUMER ADVISORY IS INSUFFICIENT. ADVISORY HAS REMINDER BUT NOT DISCLOSURE AND FOODS THAT ARE POTENTIALLY UNDERCOOKED DO NOT HAVE ASTERISK OR INDICATOR .  RECOMMEND PUTTING THIS EXACT VERBAGE ON CONSUMER ADVISORY" Denotes items that are served raw or undercooked, and contain ( or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions."

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  PIC states that undercooked eggs are not specifically offered, but that they will honor requests for undercooked eggs.  If these requests are honored, a consumer advisory must be provided.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Facility is using a vacuum sealer to seal, although not using the vac-seal setting, only to seal. The intent is for simplifying storage for travel, not to extend shelf life.  Facility does not normally use this method. Notify EHS in the event that it is used again to determine if a HACCP would be required.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; Several packages of Thawed Salmon are stored in vacuum sealed bags from the manufacture, labeled: "remove all packaging". Fish shall remain frozen in vacuum / ROP packaging. Remove vacuum bags before thawing.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; SALMON is Thawed and held refrigerated in Vacuum Packaging that is labeled to remove from packaging before thawing. FISH in Reduced Oxygen Packaging shall be Frozen; remove from package before thawing.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; TUNA is thawed and stored in VACUUM PACKAGING that is individually labeled with instructions "remove vacuum packaging before thawing".   .  .   .  *comment on the last inspection report:  "TUNA received in Vacuum Packaging is Labeled to remove from packaging before thawing. shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.12; No data logger was present at facility or inside walk-in cooler and manager on duty did not know what a data logger was. To conduct cook-chill, food undergoing the cook-chill process must be 'held in a refrigeration unit that is equipped with an electronic system that continuously monitors time and temperature and is visually examined for proper operation twice daily.' Install and use a data logger to monitor walk-in cooler temperature.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Sushi chef has an approved variance for sushi rice but did not have the ph buffer solutions onsite to show that the ph meter was working properly. A new kit has been ordered. Ph has to be recorded daily and ph meter must be shown to be accurate. REHS will return to check on compliance.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; 0 points; Approved HACCP plan is being followed, but at least 10 cooling logs from the month of January were missing. In addition to that, cooling logs are not being initialed. Make sure all cooling logs are kept for 180 days and that employees are initialing the cooling logs as well.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; 0 points; Cooling logs had been recently sent to corporate but among the few logs for the month of June, one item had not cooled to 70 F within required time limits (2 hrs) and no corrective action was taken (or if it was, it was not written down). Make sure to record all corrective actions and follow HACCP plan by discarding foods that do not drop to 70 F or below within 2 hours.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Repeat Violation-Cooling logs are much better maintained from last inspection and cooling logs were being filled out during cook-chill process, however, 8 201.14(D)(6) requires that 'Records to be maintained by the Person In Charge to demonstrate that the HACCP Plan is properly operated and managed.' Today, data logger data could not be produced because the old computer no longer functions and data was not backed up, meaning that no data logger information is available at establishment. New computer has been purchased but data logger software has not been installed on it yet. Install data logger software so that device can be used and backup data so that it is not lost in the future. In addition to that, use the hourly cooling logs in the HACCP plan, not the 2-hour cooling logs that are currently in use.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-103.12; Repeat Violation-Cooling logs are not being completed in full, on a consistent basis. Foods that are cooked later in the day are not monitored until they cool to the required 41 F. All food must cool from 135 F to 70 F within 2 hours and from 70 F to 41 F within an additional 4 hours. Make sure to record/follow all cooling all the way to 41 F.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  The consumer advisory posted at the sushi prep case is not sufficient to satisfy Food Code requirements. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Items such as eggs and or meats may be cooked less than the required minimum cook temperature for safe food, if the customer orders the food that way and you provide a proper consumer advisory.   There are several ways to do it but most places choose to do it on the menu as you have tried to do.  You have an asterisk next to egg item and since your eggs are pasteurized in the shell a consumer advisory is not required for the eggs. If you do cook hamburgers less than 155 degrees or you cook steak less than 145 degrees then a proper consumer advisory is needed, (unless the steak is whole, tenderized and not injected and all outside surfaces are heated to over 145 degrees). An asterisk should be after the meat item and not at the end of the sentence.   Then at the bottom of the page your foot note should contain two parts, a disclosure statement such as: *This item may be cooked to order.(Followed by the reminder:) Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.  ......  FYI Also some places add a statement such as: Please inform your server if a person in your party has a food allergy.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; The consumer advisory printed in the menu is correct but the monthly featured Build Your Own Skillet order sheets do not have any consumer advisory information for cooked to order eggs. If the customer can use the sheet to order eggs cooked to order without reading the menu, the order sheet or other printed means should inform the customer of the risk of consuming under cooked eggs. CDI by educating PIC.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core;  No HACCP plan available for making yogurt and making sprouts; Before engaging in an activity that requires a HACCP PLAN, a PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall submit to the REGULATORY AUTHORITY for approval a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 8 201.14 and the relevant provisions of this Code if: (1) Submission of a HACCP PLAN is required according to LAW; (2) A VARIANCE is required as specified under Subparagraph 3-401.11(D)(4), ? 3 502.11, or ? 4 204.110(B); (3) The REGULATORY AUTHORITY determines that a FOOD preparation or processing method requires a VARIANCE based on a plan submittal specified under ? 8 201.12, an inspectional finding, or a VARIANCE request. (B) A PERMIT applicant or PERMIT HOLDER shall have a properly prepared HACCP PLAN as specified under ? 3 502.12For a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT that is required under ? 8 201.13 to have a HACCP PLAN, the plan and specifications shall indicate; work on HACCP plan to prove yogurt is safe.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core - Establishment is performing a specialized food preparation process (reduced oxygen packaging (ROP) of cooked meats, deli meat, raw fish, raw meat, cheeses) and HACCP plans have been developed but are not complete and have not been approved by Wake County Environmental Services. This specialized process requires a HACCP plan but NOT a variance. Submit to your inspector the complete documentation for your HACCP plan for raw beef, raw poultry, raw pork and raw vegetables only, following the requirements of 8-201.14 which includes the contents of a HACCP plan. Also refer to 3-502.12 for other information. (NOTE: According to Section 3-502.12(C) in the NC Food Code Manual, except for fish that is frozen before, during and after packaging, a food establishment may not package fish using a reduced oxygen packaging method...Therefore, discontinue vacuum packaging thawed fish.) Discontinue all vacuum packaging in this facility until a HACCP plan is fully developed and approved by our department and can be used for ROP of raw beef, poultry and pork and raw vegetables only. A variance will be needed for other foods mentioned above.

Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as ?Hamburger (cooked to order),? the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: ?Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.? (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 - The manager stated that they serve soft eggs to order for breakfast and there is no Consumer Advisory. Anytime raw or undercooked foods are served a Consumer Advisory must be displayed. CDI - education.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (raw fish sushi) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.   Strongly recommend that establishment put in place table tents or other adequate notification until menus are reprinted.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 8-201.13; Core; 0 points; Instacure #1 (which contains sodium nitrite) was found in walk-in cooler. Curing is not allowed without permission and/or a HACCP plan and a variance from the State of North Carolina. Operator stated that they are not curing and no other evidence of curing was found. CDI-Operator discarded Instacure #1 container. If facility has desire to cure, permission must be granted PRIOR to conducting curing.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

Submission requirements are being worked out.  Wakegov.com can be used as a reference for when application is ready. Continue to follow the daily testing with the pH meter and recording of the results as previously approved, with the understanding that in the near future, the process and recipe will require state approval.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 VARIANCE obtained from the state variance committee is required to acidiy rice and hold without temperature control (unless it is labeled to be discarded in 4 hours or less). Establishment observed to acidify rice with the intention of rendering it a non-PHF. Variance request information provided today. An alternative to maintaining the rice above 135'F or refrigerating below 45/41'F is to have written procedures that are followed with rice labeled and held for a maximum of 4 hours; food must be discarded at 4 hours.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment offers undercooked animal-based food (sushi rolls with raw fish) and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "sashimi (contains raw fish)" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available.) Please note that steaks are exempt only if certified by the vendor as from whole muscle, intact beef. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation;  A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Pf
(A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; Pf
(B) Curing FOOD; Pf
(C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: Pf
(1) As a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement, Pf or
(2) To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL OF SAFETY FOOD); Pf

(D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12

Variance request form was provided today and must be completed and submitted for review and approval by te State Varaince Committee.  Also include the corporate HACCP plan and all procedures associated with the ROP processes and Curing when it involves the use of Char Crust, the "PINK SALT" product containing 6.25 percent Sodium Nitrite. CDI-education

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Sushi rice is being held under no time/temperature control and facility does not have a variance. Representative of the sushi company told me on the phone they have submitted an application for a variance and are awaiting a response. In the meantime, as the rice is held off-temperature, this facility must use time as a control. Time as a Public Health Control procedures have been written and approved on site. These procedures must be available and followed for inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

Acidfying rice for sushi is considered a specialized process and requires a variance. EHS will provide information on obtaining a variance if desired, otherwise acidifying rice to create a non-potentially hazardous food must stop. CDI by educating PIC.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

Both of these items would require a variance because they are made by using specialized processes. They need to be removed from the facility and should not be sold to customers. Items were removed during inspection.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11 (D) . Sauces and soups are sealed in bags for use on another day. This process is called reduced oxygen packaging and require a variance and a HACCP plan. Keep a copy of both in the restaurant. This was mentioned on the previous inspection.

(D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12;

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility par cooking chicken and does not have a written procedure; A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; educated on rules.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Facility curing corned beef using nitrite compound; must have a variance and a HACCP plan; Facility also par cooking chicken wings; must have a written procedure for chicken wings as per rule 3-401.14.  A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY as specified in § 8 103.10 and under § 8 103.11 before: (A) Smoking FOOD as a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement; (B) Curing FOOD; (C) Using FOOD ADDITIVES or adding components such as vinegar: (1) As a method of FOOD preservation rather than as a method of flavor enhancement, or (2) To render a FOOD so that it is not POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS (TIME/TEMPERATURE CONTROL OF SAFETY FOOD); (D) Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled as specified under § 3 502.12; Pf (E) Operating a MOLLUSCAN SHELLFISH life-support system display tank used to store or display shellfish that are offered for human consumption; (F) Custom processing animals that are for personal use as FOOD and not for sale or service in a FOOD ESTABLISHMENT; (G) Preparing FOOD by another method that is determined by the REGULATORY AUTHORITY to require a VARIANCE; or (H) Sprouting seeds or beans. Educated on rules. Facility must not brine corned beef in nitrate solution until a HACCP plan and variance has been approved by this Department.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Cooked meats and raw meat product were being reduced oxygen packaged in facility. Facility must obtain a variance approval for this specialized process. All cooked reduced oxygen packaged items in the facility were voluntarily discarded by managers.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Repeat Violation-A variance is required to continue using curing salt. Even though it is being used for color enhancement and items are being cooked immediately after curing salt is applied, sodium nitrite is still considered a food additive and the state must approve its use. Discontinue using curing salt until a variance has been approved from the state. CDI-The Butcher Market has applied for a variance twice.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; Repeat Violation-A variance is required to continue using curing salt. shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan

This process requires a variance from the NC State Variance Committee, which will include a HACCP plan. Immediately discontinue curing bacon or any other specialized processes in this establishment. CDI by discarding bacon and curing salt on site.

shortdesc: Compliance with variance, specialized process, reduced oxygen packaging criteria or HACCP plan
comments: 3-502.11; Priority Foundation; The Wandering Moose MFU was vacuum sealing cooked chicken and using curing salt (as evidenced by recipes and open bags of curing salt). A FOOD ESTABLISHMENT shall obtain a VARIANCE from the REGULATORY AUTHORITY before Curing FOOD, Smoking FOOD, Packaging FOOD using a REDUCED OXYGEN PACKAGING method except where the growth of and toxin formation by Clostridium botulinum and the growth of Listeria monocytogenes are controlled. Prior to continuing these processes, apply for and get an approved variance from the state of NC. 'Curing is not approved' is written on current permit. Permit can be suspended if specialized processes continue. Jo Hill will make a return visit in 10 days (June 5th) to ensure that all of these items are no longer at commissary and that these processes are no longer occurring. CORRECTIONS: Wandering Moose operator, Matt was called, and he stated that all vacuum sealed food was prepared/sealed yesterday. He gave permission for bags to be opened and a commissary employee opened all vacuum sealed bags to reintroduce oxygen.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (PIC added asterisks to items offered undercooked, but menu lacks disclosure; children's menu containing burger is also asterisked). Comminuted meat may be offered for sale undercooked, unless "[...] the FOOD, if served or offered for service by CONSUMER selection from a children’s menu, does not contain COMMINUTED MEAT" - see 3-401.11. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. This issue must be corrected by 3/11/14. Return visit will be made to check consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: (A) Except as specified in ¶ 3-401.11(C) and Subparagraph

3-401.11(D)(4) and under ¶ 3-801.11(C), if an animal FOOD such as beef, EGGS, FISH, lamb, milk, pork, POULTRY, or shellfish is served or sold raw, undercooked, or without otherwise being processed to eliminate pathogens, either in READY-TO-EAT form or as an ingredient in another READY-TO-EAT FOOD, the PERMIT HOLDER shall inform CONSUMERS of the significantly increased RISK of consuming such FOODS by way of a DISCLOSURE and REMINDER, as specified in ¶¶ (B) and (C) of this section using brochures, deli case or menu advisories, label statements, table tents, placards, or other effective written means. Pf
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf 3-603.11

PIC STATED THAT THE ONLY FOOD IN FACILITY THAT IS EVER UNDERCOOKED IS BEEF.  CONSUMER ADVISORY NEEDS TO BE CLEARLY POSTED IN DINING ROOM OR ON MENU. PRODUCTS THAT CAN BE UNDERCOOKED SHOULD BE ASTERISKED TO REFERENCE THE POSTED CONSUMER ADVISORY. REHS PROVIDED A CONSUMER ADVISORY TO PIC TO BE POSTED IN DINING AREA. RECOMMEND PUTTING CONSUMER ADVISORY ON MENU AS WELL.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (sushi rolls with raw fish, for example) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as "sashimi (contains raw fish)" or “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before  modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Provide a consumer advisory for nightly specials (steak, raw oysters) and for raw egg caesar dressing.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. (Consumer advisory present on menu, but fails to include portion of disclosure indicating that items may be undercooked or cooked to order.) Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. Please note that the Rule does not require that all animal foods be included in consumer advisory.  Only those that may be cooked to order or served undercooked are required to be included.  Shrimp in shrimp scampi is not eligible for listing in consumer advisory unless purchased with certification that it has parasite destruction.  Poultry, while technically able to be listed, is typically not intended for undercooked consumption and should be fully cooked.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Undercooked hamburgers are being sold but no consumer advisory is posted or written on menus. Provide. Go to wakegov.com/food for example.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food in raw or undercooked form but does not have insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any animal-based food with the exception of some steaks that are served raw or undercooked. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food (ribeye, lamb shanks) and has insufficient consumer advisory.  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, to verify whether or not steaks in use require consumer advisory, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.  CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (improper disclosure on breakfast menu which was in the office; PIC stated this is the one they currently use). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Hamburger (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Facility is printing new menus, make sure to send EHS a copy to approve prior to printing. Do not asterisk items that are not really offered undercooked. Per PIC, fish/salmon are no longer offered undercooked so that parasite destruction records don't have to be kept, but it is still on the menu. Also, it seems that the prime rib is not meeting the heating requirements to eliminate an advisory requirements, EHS provided copy of 3-401.11, make sure consumer advisory is provided for prime rib.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (Reminder is provided at Mongolian grill and at sushi station, but no disclosure is provided). Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Sushi may be served raw or undercooked," or "Beef is cooked to order" and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements are available; ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI-PIC edited consumer advisory for both stations.

Hamburgers on a kids menu may not be served cooked less than 155 degrees, so it should not be included in the consumer advisory. There are several items under the Entr?e heading that are served fully cooked and should not be part of a consumer advisory.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  REQRUIED FOR ANY ESTALBISHMENT THAT SERVES FOOD RAW OR UNDER COOKED:  B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or

(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients. Pf
(C) REMINDER shall include asterisking the animal-derived FOODS requiring DISCLOSURE to a footnote that states:
(1) Regarding the safety of these items, written information is available upon request; Pf
(2) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness; Pf or
(3) Consuming raw or undercooked MEATS, POULTRY, seafood, shellfish, or EGGS may increase your RISK of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. Pf

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Menus observed today didn't have the 'cooked to order' part of the advisory. This must be added at the next menu printing.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Found one menu with insufficient consumer advisory for foods offered raw or uncooked to customers (menu in bar area). No disclosure statement was found. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, where the menu must indicate where specific foods may be served raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." NOTE: Always remember to asterisk the actual foods that may be consumed raw or undercooked. CDI by educating PIC about requirements.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food (eggs, seafood, etc.) and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a DISCLOSURE, declaring that the food may be consumed raw or undercooked, and the disclosure must be asterisked to a REMINDER stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." CDI by informing PIC of requirements.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation;  Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogens - No consumer advisory on lunch menu.  Establishment found to offer at least one undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, wherein the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as ?Hamburger (cooked to order),? and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: ?Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.? (Two alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule, or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu. CDI by educating PIC. Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection. CDI-Education

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Food in good condition, safe & unadulterated

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food in raw or undercooked form but does not have insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any animal-based food with the exception of some steaks that are served raw or undercooked. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 You have attempted to do a consumer advisory but it is incomplete and not correct. [There are several ways it could be done, this is one way.] Any meat or egg item that could be ordered cooked less than the minimum required cook temperature should have an asterisk following that item. Then at the bottom of the page there should be a footnote that starts with an asterisk and the footnote should include two parts a disclosure statement such as "This menu item may be cooked to order" and a reminder such as "Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogension  - Consumer advisory on menu is as required.  However, bottom portion of reminder statement is cut off on lunch menu.  Ensure that entire consumer advisory is printed and legible.  Educational note:  Menu includes salmon, with no indication that it may be offered undercooked.  PIC states that establishment does occasionally receive requests for undercooked salmon.  IF REQUESTS FOR UNDERCOOKED SALMON ARE HONORED: 1) Salmon must be included in consumer advisory; and 2) Establishment must have documentation of parasite distruction by freezing OR documentation that salmon is aquacultured and fed parasite free foods (see 3-402.11 Parasite Destruction).  Do not honor requests for undercooked salmon until these two items are in place.  CDI by this guidance.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 Consumption of Animal Foods that are Raw, Undercooked, or Not Otherwise Processed to Eliminate Pathogension  - Consumer advisory on menu is as required.  However, bottom portion of reminder statement is cut off on lunch menu.  Ensure that entire consumer advisory is printed and legible.  Educational note:  Menu includes salmon, with no indication that it may be offered undercooked.  PIC states that establishment does occasionally receive requests for undercooked salmon.  IF REQUESTS FOR UNDERCOOKED SALMON ARE HONORED: 1) Salmon must be included in consumer advisory; and 2) Establishment must have documentation of parasite distruction by freezing OR documentation that salmon is aquacultured and fed parasite free foods (see 3-402.11 Parasite Destruction).  Do not honor requests for undercooked salmon until these two items are in place.  CDI by this guidance.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11- Establishment found to offer meat, seafood, and/or eggs that could be served raw or undercooked but does not have sufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw meat, seafood, or eggs. Whole-muscle, intact beef steaks that meet the conditions of 3-201.11(E) do not require consumer advisory. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked(*) and refer to a reminder. For more information on consumer advisory consult your inspector or visit www.wakegov.com/food. CDI by educating PIC, follow up for consumer advisory during next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: Pf - 3-603.11 - Establishment offers at least one raw or undercooked animal-based food and has insufficient consumer advisory (eggs).  Consumer advisory shall be provided for any raw or undercooked animal-based food with the exception of some steaks.  Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure, where the name of the food on the menu indicates that it may be served undercooked, such as "Eggs (cooked to order)," and the disclosure must be asterisked to a reminder stating the following: "Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness." (Two alternate statements may be used. Please contact your inspector with any questions about this rule or to have proposed wording approved before modifying menu.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Consumer Advisory needs adjustment. EACH Item that may be under-cooked needs to be designated (not just the categories of "Entrees" and "American Burger-Wiches").  Reminder is present but Disclosure is missing (i.e can be cooked to order)

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Your consumer advisory is not complete. Each ground beef burger should have an asterick (*) next to it and then another asterick at the bottom of the page followed by ...*This item may be cooked to order. Consuming raw or undercooked meats , poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness, especially if you have certain medical conditions. (Your proposed CA, I think will be OK. )

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11; Priority Foundation; Establishment found to offer at least one animal-based food in raw or undercooked form but does not have insufficient consumer advisory. Consumer advisory shall be provided for any animal-based food with the exception of some steaks that are served raw or undercooked. Consumer advisory must consist of a disclosure with the name of the food on the menu indicating that it may be served raw or undercooked, such as “Hamburger (cooked to order),” the food included in the disclosure must be asterisked and refer to a reminder stating the following: “Consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish, or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness.” (Alternate statements are available, ask your inspector if you have questions.) CDI by educating PIC.  Item to be re-evaluated at next inspection. Consumer advisory information left during inspection.

shortdesc: Consumer advisory provided for raw or undercooked foods
comments: 3-603.11 (B) . The menu has a consumer advisory, but no disclosure. The disclosure tells the customer that a menu item contains raw fish or meat. The disclosure can be added to the advisory at the bottom of the menu, for example "all sushi may contain raw fish". You can also add it at the top of the sushi page.
(B) DISCLOSURE shall include:
(1) A description of the animal-derived FOODS, such as “oysters on the half shell (raw oysters),” “raw-EGG Caesar salad,” and “hamburgers (can be cooked to order)”; Pf or
(2) Identification of the animal-derived FOODS by asterisking them to a footnote that states that the items are served raw or undercooked, or contain (or may contain) raw or undercooked ingredients.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-103.11 (M); Priority Foundation; Person in charge (PIC) unable to provide documentation of an employee health policy that meets the requirements of the Rules. Employees and conditional employees shall be notified of when they need to stay home while ill and what the requirements are for them to return to work after being ill. The PIC is responsible for ensuring that this notification is made and that restrictions (i.e. limited duties) and exclusions (requiring that an employee not work in the establishment) are enforced as appropriate. Reference materials given (in English and Spanish)and explained during inspection.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

Owner/PIC stated that she knew of the policy and thought she had it in another folder that was currently not in her possession. Make sure to keep documentation of your employee health policy available at all times. EHS left Form 1B and educational poster with operator, CDI.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-103.11 (M); Priority Foundation; The manager did not have an employee policy health agreement on hand that meets the current rules. Employees must know when to stay home from work while ill and what needs to be done before they can return to work. CDI..... A sample form was given to the manager on duty.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-103.11 (M); Priority Foundation; PIC provided a copy of "Food Borne Illness Prevention Policy", but this policy does not meet the requirements of NC Food Code. It does not require the employee to report jaundice or sore throat with fever. It does not give clear direction on what the exclusion requirements are for nondiagnosed, symptomatic employees. It makes no reference to reporting to the requlatory authority requirements. EHS provided a copy of form 1B and reporting/restriction/exclusion guidance. Facility may use form 1B for employees until the corporate policy is corrected.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-103.11 (M); Priority Foundation; Reviewed employee health policy during inspection and most of the basic information is correct, however, 1 illnesses listed is not specific enough to comply with NC Food Code requirements. On document available in facility, only E.coli is listed; in order to comply with Food Code, E.coli 0157:H7, Enterohemorrhagic (ETEC) and Shiga toxin-producing (STEC) E. coli must be listed. Policy needs to be updated to include the specific illnesses. The policy also does not include restriction or exclusion time (24-48 hours depending on symptoms/illness), this information should be added to policy so that employees are fully aware how long that have to be out of work if they report foodborne illness symptoms or are diagnosed with a foodborne illness. This was documented in the notes section of the previous inspection report. CDI by educating PIC and giving copy of updated form 1B. Failure to comply during next inspection will result in point deduction.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: 2-103.11 (M); Priority Foundation; The person-in-charge did not have a copy of the employee policy health agreement that meets the current rules. Employees and conditional employees must know when to stay home from work while ill. Employees must know what steps need to be taken before they can return to work. CDI.... A sample form was left with the manager on duty.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

comments: 2-201.11 - Facility has an employee health policy in place but it does not discuss excluding or restricting employees with open infectious wounds or cuts on hands or arms. Be sure that the employee health policy in place meets the requirements of an approved employee health policy. CDI - educated manager and asked her to talk to her supervisor for further guidance.

Have each employee read and sign a copy. Keep this document on file and available upon request.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting
comments: There is no Employee Health Policy in place.

The PERMIT HOLDER shall require FOOD EMPLOYEES and CONDITIONAL EMPLOYEES to report to the PERSON IN CHARGE information about their health and activities as they relate to diseases that are transmissible through FOOD. A FOOD EMPLOYEE or CONDITIONAL EMPLOYEE shall report the information in a manner that allows the PERSON IN CHARGE to reduce the RISK of foodborne disease transmission, including providing necessary additional information, such as the date of onset of symptoms and an illness, or of a diagnosis without symptoms. CDI - educated and provided matertial to the manager Vinny about how to implement an approved Employee Health Policy. 2-201.11

Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: Pf - 3-402.12 - Sashimi grade farm raised salmon (cooked to order) that is obtained fresh from supplier is served in this establishment. No parasite destruction information was provided showing fish is fed parasite free feed. Obtain this information from supplier. If this information is not provided, salmon must be cooked to at least 145F for 15 seconds throughout the product. CDI by informing PIC of requirement.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-402.12; Priority Foundation; Establishment has parasite destruction letter, but lacks latest invoice. New Rules require that proof of parasite destruction be kept for 90 days. Keep invoices (or copies) on hand in restaurant for at least that amount of time. Recommend obtaining a new parasite destruction letter with each seafood shipment. CDI by this guidance.  Follow up visit in 10 days to verify invoice.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-402.12; Priority Foundation;  No documentation on salmon stating it is shashimi grade as per stated rule; If raw, raw-marinated, partially cooked, or marinated-partially cooked FISH are served or sold in READY-TO-EAT form, and the FISH are raised and fed as specified in Subparagraph 3 402.11(B)(3), a written agreement or statement from the supplier or aquaculturist stipulating that the FISH were raised and fed as specified in Subparagraph 3 402.11(B)(3) shall be obtained by the PERSON IN CHARGE and retained in the records of the FOOD ESTABLISHMENT for 90 calendar days beyond the time of service or sale of the FISH.

shortdesc: Management, employees knowledge; responsibilities & reporting

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-402.12; Priority Foundation - PIC showed a letter with some fish (used in sushi in this facility) that has been frozen correctly for parasite destruction, but not all raw fish used for sushi in restaurant are listed on letter. Provide an updated letter from supplier with ALL raw fish used in sushi sold at this establishment. Also, PIC stated that fresh salmon is received from supplier but no proper parasite destruction information was provided...All raw fish that is received frozen and is served raw or undercooked in this establishment must have proper parasite destruction documentation that is up-to-date from all fish suppliers. If fish is received fresh (not frozen), such as salmon, written documentation from supplier must be available to show this fish has been fed food that is parasite-free. Not corrected during inspection.

shortdesc: Required records available: shellstock tags, parasite destruction
comments: 3-402.12; Statement was provided that says farm raised fish were fed "pallet" feed.  Insure fish are fed in accordance with:  3-401.11(b)(3)
(3) Aquacultured FISH, such as salmon, that:
(a) If raised in open water, are raised in net-pens, or
(b) Are raised in land-based operations such as ponds or tanks, and
(c) Are fed formulated feed, such as pellets, that contains no live parasites infective to the aquacultured FISH. Priority Foundation; CDI EDUCATION
